class_definitions.documentation: Represents clinical statements that cannot be further decomposed into multiple independent clinical statements, i.e., all clinical statements that are not CompoundClinicalStatements. An indivisible clinical statement must be able to stand alone such as a systolic blood pressure measurement which can be interpreted both inside a blood pressure panel or on its own. If the statement cannot stand alone, e.g., the size of a wound, which cannot exist outside the context of the wound itself, then the Component class should be used instead.
class_definitions.name: IndivisibleClinicalStatement

class_definitions.documentation: A CompoundClinicalStatement is a clinical statement representing a collection of independent clinical statements. Each statement within a compound clinical statement may exist outside of the context of the compound clinical statement without any alteration to its meaning. An example is a Panel. Note that complex medications are indivisible clinical statements even though their structure may be a composite data structure. They are generally treated as an independent entry in a record and their parts do not constitute independent entries in a record.
class_definitions.name: CompoundClinicalStatement

properties.documentation: The clinical statements that make up the composite statement, for instance, the individual measurements in a Complete Blood Count.
properties.name: content

class_definitions.documentation:
A special type of information entry consisting of a topic and a context. The ClinicalStatement class provides the core pattern for more specific clinical statement archetypes, such as a statement that a finding has been found in a patient or that a procedure has been proposed by a clinical decision support system.
The ClinicalStatement pattern defines the core attributes common to most clinical statements and specifies a composition pattern that encourage model component reuse and better alignment with the SNOMED CT Concept Model.
A clinical statement is composed of the StatementTopic class (grouping of attributes for capturing information about a procedure or a clinical finding) and the StatementContext class (grouping of attributes providing the context for the statement topic such as whether a procedure was performed, requested, not performed or whether a finding is suspected present or absent in the patient). At the archetype level, the topic and context components are coordinated to form the clinical statement. For instance, the composition of the ProcedureTopic with the NotPerformed context indicates that the given procedure was not performed.
class_definitions.name: ClinicalStatement

properties.documentation: What the statement is about, e.g., the kind of finding or action. The range of this attribute is a structure (StatementTopic) rather than a value set. For instance, if the 'topic' attribute's meaning is bound to 'ProcedureTopic, then the topic must be a specialization of ProcedureTopic. This attribute aligns with the SNOMED CT 'Associated finding (attribute)' (SCTID: 246090004) and 'Associated procedure (attribute)' (SCTID: 363589002).
properties.name: topic

properties.documentation: The ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc. Attribute aligns with the SNOMED CT Situation with Explicit Context (SWEC) Concept Model context attributes 'Finding context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408729009) and 'Procedure context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408730004). The range of this attribute is a structure (StatementContext) rather than a value set. The context of the clinical statement must align with the range specified by the SWEC Concept Model. For instance, if the 'context' attribute's meaning is bound to 'Finding context', then the context may not be a specialization of the ActionContext statement context. Instead, it should be a specialization of the FindingContext statement context.
properties.name: context

properties.documentation: Encounter associated with this clinical statement.
properties.name: encounter

class_definitions.documentation: The component abstract class is used to represent dependent observations, findings, or procedures associated with the parent clinical statement. A dependent component is a component that does not have an independent existence outside of its parent. For instance, the description of a wound bed must exist in the context of a wound assertion. However, a systolic blood pressure measurement can exist independently of a blood pressure panel. This distinction is important. Collections of independent statements should be represented using the composition structure offered by the CompoundClinicalStatement class. Collections of dependent structures should be modeled using the Component pattern.
class_definitions.name: Component

properties.documentation: The topic of the Component. See ClinicalStatement.topic for details.
properties.name: topic

properties.documentation: The context associated with the topic of the component. See ClinicalStatement.context for details.
properties.name: context

class_definitions.documentation: An entry in a patient record or in a report, generally used for the documentation of clinical information about a subject of information such as a patient or a relative of the patient, asserted by a particular source, recorded, and potentially verified.
class_definitions.name: InformationEntry

properties.documentation: A unique identifier(s) for this clinical statement. Some identifiers may include version information.
properties.name: identifier

properties.documentation: The subject of the entry, which is unusually the patient, but may also be a relative of the patient, a a cohort, a device, etc. When the subject of information is the same as the subject of record, the relationship 'self' is used. In cases such as family history or descriptions of device (mal)function, the relationship type is something other than 'self'. This attribute aligns with the SNOMED CT Situation with Explicit Context (SWEC) and is bound to the SNOMED attribute: 'Subject relationship context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408732007).
properties.name: subjectOfInformation

properties.documentation: Attribution information integral to the content of this entry, such as who recorded the entry into the underlying system. Any changes to the attribution information will result in either a version change or a new information entry. If such information does not impact the entry itself, Provenance should be used instead.
properties.name: attribution

properties.documentation: An unstructured note appended to the information entry.
properties.name: additionalText

properties.documentation: Concept indicating the state of this record, e.g., 'entered in error'.
properties.name: recordStatus

class_definitions.documentation: A reference range for the specific instance after lookup from, say, a reference range table given specific criteria. Note that this reference range is not definitional in nature but rather refers to the reference range considered for the given observation for a subject.
class_definitions.name: ReferenceRange

properties.documentation: ] Indicates how the given range should be interpreted, for example, as normal, critically high, etc.
properties.name: referenceCriterion

properties.documentation: A human-oriented description of the reference range.
properties.name: narrative

properties.documentation: The specific criteria that apply for the given reference range. For instance, reference ranges may be specified in a lookup table based on a set of criteria. If a row in this table is selected as the applicable reference range for a measurement, 'criteria' lists the specific criteria for that row in the table. E.g., reference range for post-menopausal women.
properties.name: criteria

class_definitions.documentation: Structure capturing usage preferences for, say, a name, an address, or contact information.
class_definitions.name: Use

properties.documentation: A code for the use.
properties.name: value

properties.documentation: Period when the use is in effect.
properties.name: dateTimeRange

class_definitions.documentation: A reference range specified by a quantitative interval.
class_definitions.name: QuantitativeReferenceRange

properties.documentation: The specified reference range.
properties.name: range

class_definitions.documentation: A qualitative reference range specified by a code - e.g., abnormal, severely abnormal.
class_definitions.name: QualitativeReferenceRange

properties.documentation: Code representing the reference range.
properties.name: referenceValue

class_definitions.documentation: A note containing information relevant to an entry, also containing information about who commented and when.
class_definitions.name: Annotation

properties.documentation: The attribution for the given comment or note.
properties.name: authored

properties.documentation: The annotation's text content.
properties.name: content

class_definitions.documentation: When a repeated event is to occur.
class_definitions.name: Repeat

properties.documentation: A day of the week such as Monday, Sunday.
properties.name: dayOfWeek

properties.documentation: Time of day for action, independent of time zone or date, for example, 10:00 am.
properties.name: timeOfDay

properties.documentation: A timing abbreviation such as TID or Q8H that expresses both the frequency of the action in a period of time but also whether the interval between events is fixed (every 8 hours) or variable (before meals, when awake).
properties.name: code

class_definitions.documentation: A process where a researcher or organization plans and then executes a series of steps intended to increase the field of healthcare-related knowledge. This includes studies of safety, efficacy, comparative effectiveness and other information about medications, devices, therapies and other interventional and investigative techniques. A ResearchStudy involves the gathering of information about human or animal subjects.
class_definitions.name: ResearchStudy

properties.documentation: Identifiers assigned to this research study by the sponsor or other systems.
properties.name: identifier

properties.documentation: A short, descriptive user-friendly label for the study.
properties.name: title

properties.documentation: A larger research study of which this particular study is a component or step.
properties.name: partOf

properties.documentation: The current state of the study.
properties.name: status

properties.documentation: Codes categorizing the type of study such as investigational vs. observational, type of blinding, type of randomization, safety vs. efficacy, etc.
properties.name: category

properties.documentation: The condition(s), medication(s), food(s), therapy(ies), device(s) or other concerns or interventions that the study is seeking to gain more information about.
properties.name: focus

properties.documentation: Contact details to assist a user in learning more about or engaging with the study.
properties.name: contact

properties.documentation: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.
properties.name: keyword

properties.documentation: Indicates the country, state or other region taking legal responsibility for the conduct of the study.
properties.name: jurisdiction

properties.documentation: A full description of how the study is being conducted.
properties.name: description

properties.documentation: Identifies the start date and the expected (or actual, depending on status) end date for the study.
properties.name: studyPeriod

properties.documentation: The organization responsible for the execution of the study.
properties.name: sponsor

properties.documentation: Indicates the individual who has primary oversite of the execution of the study.
properties.name: principalInvestigator

properties.documentation: Clinic, hospital or other healthcare location that is participating in the study.
properties.name: site

properties.documentation: A description and/or code explaining the premature termination of the study.
properties.name: reasonStopped

properties.documentation: Comments made about the event by the performer, subject or other participants.
properties.name: note

properties.documentation: Arm refers to a pre-specified group or subgroup of participants in a clinical trial assigned to receive specific interventions (or no intervention) according to a protocol.
properties.name: arm

class_definitions.documentation: A timing expression such as points in time when an activity was performed, a frequency of occurrence, or a relative timing expression relative to some event.
class_definitions.name: Timing

class_definitions.documentation: A timing expression expressed as a point on a timeline, e.g., a date, time, or timestamp.
class_definitions.name: DiscreteTiming

properties.documentation: When an event occurs.
properties.name: pointInTime

class_definitions.documentation: A timing expression that is not expressed as calendar time. RepeatTiming expressions tend to be relative timing expressions or frequency-based timing expressions.
class_definitions.name: RepeatTiming

properties.documentation: Duration of action when it happens.
properties.name: activityDuration

properties.documentation: A landmark, such as admission, discharge, rising, mealtime, or bedtime, relative to when an event should take place.
properties.name: event

properties.documentation: A duration before or after a given life event, for example, 30 minutes before a meal. Whether this duration means before or after the landmark is conveyed by the life event code.
properties.name: offsetFromEvent

properties.documentation: How the action is to be repeated at the given event time or times.
properties.name: repeat

class_definitions.documentation: A timing expression expressed as a frequency.
class_definitions.name: FrequencyBasedRepeat

properties.documentation: The period of time after which the pattern repeats, for example, each day. To specify 3 times per day, the period should be 24 hours.
properties.name: period

properties.documentation: How many times the event should take place during one recurrence interval, for example, to specify 3 times per day, the countPerInterval should be 3.
properties.name: countPerPeriod

class_definitions.documentation: A repeat timing expression that is bounded within a temporal interval.
class_definitions.name: TimeBoundRepeatTiming

properties.documentation: The outer bound/duration for the timing. E.g., 'Acetaminophen 200 mg tablet' TID for three days. Here, three days represent the timing bounds.
properties.name: timingBounds

class_definitions.documentation: A repeat timing expression that is bounded by a number of iterations. For instance, a timing expression to give a medication every 15 minutes not to exceed 10 administrations.
class_definitions.name: IterationBoundRepeatTiming

properties.documentation: Number of times to repeat
properties.name: repeatCount

class_definitions.documentation: Class representing a patient or provider preference such as a diet preference, best time to contact, preferred communication method, etc ...
class_definitions.name: Preference

properties.documentation: Code indicating the preference such as 'Preferred communication method'.
properties.name: key

properties.documentation: Code indicating the value selected for this preference such as 'Email'.
properties.name: value

class_definitions.documentation: A part of the body.
class_definitions.name: AnatomicalLocation

properties.documentation: The anatomical location code
properties.name: code

properties.documentation: The side of a bilaterally duplicated structure.
properties.name: laterality

properties.documentation: A direction on with respect to planes of the body, for example, proximal, distal, lateral, medial.
properties.name: anatomicalDirection

class_definitions.documentation: Arm refers to a pre-specified group or subgroup of participants in a clinical trial assigned to receive specific interventions (or no intervention) according to a protocol. The protocol describes an expected sequence of events for one of the participants of a study, e.g. Exposure to drug A, wash-out, exposure to drug B, wash-out, follow-up.
class_definitions.name: ResearchStudyArm

properties.documentation: Unique, human-readable label for this arm of the study.
properties.name: name

properties.documentation: Categorization of study arm, e.g. experimental, active comparator, placebo comparator.
properties.name: code

properties.documentation: A succinct description of the path through the study that would be followed by a subject adhering to this arm.
properties.name: description

class_definitions.documentation: Characterizations of the physical size of an anatomical feature.
class_definitions.name: DimensionalFeature

properties.documentation: The extent of a 2-dimensional feature enclosed within a boundary, for example, the area of a wound.
properties.name: area

properties.documentation: The circumference or perimeter of a 2-dimensional view or slice of the feature.
properties.name: circumference

properties.documentation: The volume of a 3-dimensional feature. For instance, if an irregular cavity, the amount of liquid required to fill the cavity.
properties.name: volume

properties.documentation: The measurement of extent of a feature from side to side, perpendicular to the greatest dimension.
properties.name: width

properties.documentation: The extent downward or inward; the perpendicular measurement from the surface to determine the deepness of a feature.
properties.name: depth

properties.documentation: The length of a 2-dimensional view or slice of a feature.
properties.name: length

class_definitions.documentation: A role associated with the delivery or consumption of health care services.
class_definitions.name: HealthCareRole

properties.documentation: Time interval when role is assumed.
properties.name: validityPeriod

properties.documentation: Confidentiality level conferred to the role.
properties.name: confidentialityLevel

properties.documentation: The status of the role.
properties.name: status

properties.documentation: Preferences stated and captured for this role. Typically preferences refer to patient or care provider preferences such as a preferred diet (patient) or communication method (both).
properties.name: preference

class_definitions.documentation: Role associated with the delivery of health care as opposed to a consumer of health care.
class_definitions.name: HealthCareProviderRole

properties.documentation: The field of practice for the given provider.
properties.name: fieldOfPractice

properties.documentation: Classification for this role.
properties.name: providerClassification

properties.documentation: A membership, association, or connection to an organization that grants certain rights and privileges, such as admitting or visiting.
properties.name: affiliation

class_definitions.documentation: A non-person health care entity such as a medical group or other organization.
class_definitions.name: HealthCareProviderOrganizationRole

class_definitions.documentation: A healthcare provider role associated with a person.
class_definitions.name: HealthCareProviderIndividualRole

properties.documentation: A right to practice medicine obtained by training and certification.
properties.name: qualification

class_definitions.documentation: Role assumed by an entity acting as a health care consumer.
class_definitions.name: HealthCareConsumerRole

properties.documentation: Importance associated with the given role such as VIP, etc...
properties.name: importance

properties.documentation: Type of organ donor.
properties.name: organDonorType

properties.documentation: The health care provider associated with this role such as the primary provider for a patient.
properties.name: associatedHealthCareProvider

properties.documentation: Organization that is the custodian of the patient record
properties.name: managingOrganization

properties.documentation: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient
properties.name: contact

class_definitions.documentation: A role played in the subject's family, such as parent or sibling. Family members do not have to be related by blood, and can include social connections subjectively recognized by the subject as "family".
class_definitions.name: FamilyMembership

class_definitions.documentation: Base class for dispense contexts.
class_definitions.name: DispenseBase

properties.documentation: The amount that is to be or that was dispensed.
properties.name: quantity

class_definitions.documentation: Record of the dispensing event.
class_definitions.name: DispenseEvent

properties.documentation: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: The amount of medication expressed in terms of the number of days the medication will last at prescribing dosing level.
properties.name: daysSupply

properties.documentation: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.
properties.name: whenPrepared

properties.documentation: The time or date the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.
properties.name: whenHandedOver

properties.documentation: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.
properties.name: destination

properties.documentation: Identifies the party who picked up the medication. This will usually be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.
properties.name: receiver

class_definitions.documentation: Medication dispensing instructions provided by the prescriber.
class_definitions.name: DispenseInstructions

properties.documentation: Indicates whether the prescriber has authorized additional fills of this order as needed.
properties.name: areRefillsAuthorizedAsNeeded

properties.documentation: The period when this dispense request is valid.
properties.name: validityPeriod

properties.documentation: The number of times the prescription can be refilled, not counting the initial dispense. For example, if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus 3 repeats, then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets.
properties.name: numberOfRepeatsAllowed

properties.documentation: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.
properties.name: expectedSupplyDuration

class_definitions.documentation: Pattern for the dosing of a medication. Describes how medication is to be administered or how it should be taken.
class_definitions.name: DosageInstruction

properties.documentation: The order of the dosage instructions
properties.name: sequence

properties.documentation: Supplemental instructions to the patient on how to take the medication (e.g. "with meals" or "take half to one hour before food") or warnings for the patient about the medication (e.g. "may cause drowsiness" or "avoid exposure of skin to direct sunlight or sunlamps").
properties.name: additionalInstructions

properties.documentation: Instructions in terms that are understood by the patient or consumer.
properties.name: patientInstruction

properties.documentation: When medication should be administered
properties.name: timing

properties.documentation: Take "as needed" (for x)
properties.name: asNeeded

properties.documentation: Amount of medication per dose
properties.name: doseRange

properties.documentation: Amount of medication per unit of time (applicable to medication taken continuously over a period of time, such as an infusion).
properties.name: rateRange

properties.documentation: Upper limit on medication per unit of time
properties.name: maxDosePerPeriod

properties.documentation: Upper limit on medication per administration
properties.name: maxDosePerAdministration

properties.documentation: Upper limit on medication per lifetime of the patient
properties.name: maxDosePerLifetime

class_definitions.documentation: The topic for clinical statements concerned with prescribing, administering, or dispensing a medication.
class_definitions.name: MedicationProcedure

properties.documentation: Identifies the medication being administered, ordered, dispensed, or currently being taken.
properties.name: medication

properties.documentation: The device used in administering the medication to the patient. For example, a particular infusion pump.
properties.name: device

properties.documentation: Information/instructions pertaining to how the medication is to be dosed.
properties.name: dosage

class_definitions.documentation: Context for the documentation of a medication dispense event.
class_definitions.name: MedicationDispensePerformance

properties.documentation: Information about the dispense event.
properties.name: dispense

properties.documentation: Information about any substitutions performed during the dispense event.
properties.name: substitution

class_definitions.documentation: Context for a medication order.
class_definitions.name: MedicationOrder

properties.documentation: Instructions for dispensing the medication.
properties.name: dispenseInstructions

properties.documentation: Medication substitution instructions - primarily whether substitutions are allowed.
properties.name: substitutionInstructions

properties.documentation: The pharmacy order category is used to group medication orders that follow similar site-specific workflows, often for large-scale expedited processing. Examples (from HL7 V2) include medication, IV large volume solutions, and other solutions.
properties.name: pharmacyOrderCategory

properties.documentation: "Indicates where type of medication order and where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered." - HL7 FHIR, MedicationOrder.category Possible values include: Inpatient, Outpatient, Community
properties.name: pharmacyOrderSetting

class_definitions.documentation: This class represents a MedicationOrder from the perspective of the filling system (i.e., the pharmacy). This class is a subtype of Healthcare Promise, which describes all types or Orders from the filling system perspective, but adds those properties which are specific to medication orders. Although there are many properties shared with MedicationOrder; the pharmacy may change the order within prescribed limits, for example, substituting a generic drug for a branded drug.
class_definitions.name: PharmacyPromise

properties.documentation: Date and time of the appointment for this clinic location.
properties.name: appointmentTime

properties.documentation: The date after which the order may no longer be filled.
properties.name: expirationDate

properties.documentation: A flag indicating that the medication given to the patient is to be self-administered and is to be supplied by the hospital's pharmacy while they are an inpatient.
properties.name: isHospitalSupplySelfAdministered

properties.documentation: A flag indicating that the medication given to the patient is to be self administered.
properties.name: isSelfAdministered

properties.documentation: The most recent date (and optionally time) that the medication was distributed to a patient, patient care-giver, or the location at which the patient is receiving care.
properties.name: lastDispenseDate

properties.documentation: Indicates whether a warning is present in the dispensing instructions field and that downstream applications are expected to alert the human user to the presence of the warning. This property is included for compatibility with HL7 version 2.
properties.name: needsHumanReview

properties.documentation: The number of refills or repeats of the medication order that have previously been dispensed, prior to the current order.
properties.name: numberOfRefillsOrDosesDispensed

properties.documentation: The number of times the prescription can be refilled, prior to the promised dispense. If this is not the initial order and the number of refills remaining is 0, the order cannot be filled without issuance of a new MedicationOrder. For example, if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus 3 repeats, and the number of refills remaining is 1, then the promised dispense will reach the maximum order of 120 tablets. Afterward, the number of refills remaining will decrement to 0.
properties.name: numberOfRefillsRemaining

properties.documentation: Specifies when the service is to be performed and how frequently. Note that this is a complex data type that may indicate specific times or intervals (e.g., 10:00 AM, MWF, etc).
properties.name: requestedAdministrationTime

properties.documentation: The duration of an order as requested by the ordering clinician. The duration would be expressed as a number of days, weeks, hours, etc. Note that this length of time might be determined by a business rule of the facilty. For example, most facilties will have a limit of 7 days for antibiotics, and 3 days for schedule 1 drugs.
properties.name: requestedDuration

properties.documentation: "This describes the type of schedule for the dispensing of the medication(s) that make up the order. PRE-OP orders are usually considered to be ON-CALL orders, and orders dispensed as MULTI-DOSE CONTAINERS are usually considered to be FILL ON REQUEST orders. C=Continuous, O=One Time, P=PRN, R=Fill On Request, OC=On Call." (VistA)
properties.name: scheduleType
substitution

properties.documentation: "The total daily dose for this particular pharmaceutical as expressed in terms of actual dispense units." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXE-19.
properties.name: totalDailyDose

class_definitions.documentation: Base class for prospective and retrospective medication substitution information.
class_definitions.name: SubstitutionBase

properties.documentation: Why should or was (not) substitution made
properties.name: reason

class_definitions.documentation: Information about a substitution that was performed.
class_definitions.name: SubstitutionInformation

properties.documentation: Whether a substitution was or was not performed on the dispense
properties.name: wasSubstituted

properties.documentation: A code signifying the type of substitution actually made. Examples include: a generic substitution was dispensed; a therapeutic substitution was dispensed.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: Who is responsible for the substitution
properties.name: responsibleParty

class_definitions.documentation: Substitution instructions for prospective dispense clinical statements.
class_definitions.name: SubstitutionInstruction

properties.documentation: Code indicating whether substitutions are allowed.
properties.name: allowSubstitutions

class_definitions.documentation: A dosage of medication as it actually occurred, as opposed to a dosage that was planned.
class_definitions.name: DosageEvent

class_definitions.documentation: Base class for medication dosage instruction and dosage event.
class_definitions.name: Dosage

properties.documentation: How the medication should be taken, in terms of amount and timing, as a text. For instance, take 2 tablets PO TID for three days or as needed for pain.
properties.name: dosageAsText

properties.documentation: If applicable, the body site where the medication is to be administered.
properties.name: bodySite

properties.documentation: If applicable, the body site where the medication is to be administered, as a precoordinated code.
properties.name: bodySite_Concept

properties.documentation: How drug should enter body
properties.name: route

properties.documentation: The technique for administering the medication, for example, by ingestion or injection.
properties.name: method

properties.documentation: Amount of medication per dose
properties.name: dose

properties.documentation: Rate at which this medication is administered.
properties.name: rate

properties.documentation: Rate at which this medication is administered as volume (numerator) per unit time (denominator).
properties.name: rateRatio

class_definitions.documentation: Contains properties common to multiple kinds of Encounters which last more than a few hours. Such encounters typically include an admission and discharge process.
class_definitions.name: DurableEncounter

properties.documentation: Information about the admission process.
properties.name: patientAdmission

properties.documentation: Information about the transfer process
properties.name: patientTransfer

properties.documentation: Information about the discharge process.
properties.name: patientDischarge

properties.documentation: Indicates the patient's current medical condition for the purpose of communicating to non-medical outside parties, e.g., family, employer, religious minister, media, etc. Possible values include (from HL7 Table 434): satisfactory, critical, poor, stable, other, unknown.
properties.name: patientCondition

properties.documentation: "Indicates the status of the episode of care." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV2-24. Possible values include (from HL7 Table 216): Active Inpatient; Discharged Inpatient.
properties.name: patientStatus

class_definitions.documentation: A record about the admission of a patient to a facility generally for the provision of care.
class_definitions.name: Admission

properties.documentation: Indicates the acuity level assigned to the patient at the time of admission, for example, acute, chronic, comatose, critical, improved, moribund.
properties.name: levelOfCare

properties.documentation: Indicates where the patient was admitted. In the US, this field should use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 15 [which is] the Point of Origin for Admission or Visit.
properties.name: source

properties.documentation: Indicates a special diet type for a patient.
properties.name: dietType

properties.documentation: Indicates whether the patient must have pre admission testing done in order to be admitted.
properties.name: needsPreAdmitTest

properties.documentation: Uniquely identifies the patient's pre admit account. Some systems will continue to use the pre admit number as the billing number after the patient has been admitted.
properties.name: preAdmitAccount

properties.documentation: Pre-admission patient identifier
properties.name: preAdmissionIdentifier

properties.documentation: Indicates non-clinical precautions that need to be taken with the patient, for example, aggressive, blind, confused, deaf, on IV, do not resuscitate, paraplegic, etc.
properties.name: precautionCode

properties.documentation: Indicates that a patient is being re admitted to the healthcare facility and gives the circumstances.
properties.name: reAdmissionIndicator

properties.documentation: The diagnosis(es) that was the reason for hospitalization at the time of hospitalization.
properties.name: admissionDiagnosis

class_definitions.documentation: An abstract class that represents an encounter class.
class_definitions.name: Encounter

properties.documentation: Contains a set of values that control the disclosure of information about this patient
properties.name: confidentialityCode

properties.documentation: An encounter under which this encounter occurred. For instance, an encounter with a clinician while this patient was hospitalized.
properties.name: partOf

properties.documentation: The time interval starting with the administrative onset of the encounter (e.g. admission, registration, patient arrival) and ending with the patient's departure (e.g. discharge).
properties.name: activityTime

class_definitions.documentation: A diagnosis, which is a disease or injury determined to be present through evaluation of patient history, examination, and/or review of laboratory data.
class_definitions.name: Diagnosis

properties.documentation: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type).
properties.name: rank

properties.documentation: Contains a code that most closely identifies the condition or the diagnosis. This code will come from one of several commonly used coding systems, depending on the branch of medicine involved (e.g., clinical medicine, dentistry, mental health), and on the purpose (e.g., clinical, billing). The code will likely come from one of the following: Structured Nomenclature for Medicine (SNOMED), International Classifications of Diseases (ICD), Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM).
properties.name: code

properties.documentation: Contains a pointer to the finding clinical statement that most closely identifies the condition or the diagnosis.
properties.name: entry

properties.documentation: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge ...).
properties.name: role

class_definitions.documentation: A record pertaining to the discharge of a patient from an institution.
class_definitions.name: Discharge

properties.documentation: Contains the patient's anticipated location or status following the encounter (i.e., discharged to home, expired, etc.). In the US, use the Official Uniform Billing (UB) 04 2008 numeric codes found on form locator 17. Note that while the encounter is still "active" (i.e., the encounter does not have an end date yet) this attribute should be interpreted as the expected discharge disposition. When the encounter is "completed" this attribute contains the actual discharge disposition.
properties.name: disposition

properties.documentation: Flag indicating whether patient follow is required post-discharge.
properties.name: needOutpatientFollowup

properties.documentation: Pointer to a Patient Education record which documents provision of instructions to the Patient upon the completion of an Encounter. The PatientEducationPerformed class provides additional information regarding who provided the instructions and when, as well as an indication of the patient's level of understanding.
properties.name: dischargeInstructionsStatement

properties.documentation: Instructions given to the patient upon completion of an encounter.
properties.name: dischargeInstructions

properties.documentation: "The location to which the patient is assigned. It is a role played by a place at which services may be provided. Note that a single physical place can play multiple service delivery location roles each with its own attributes. For example, a Podiatry clinic and Research clinic may meet on alternate days in the same physical location; each clinic uses its own mailing address and telephone number." (HL7)
properties.name: dischargeFromLocation

properties.documentation: Indicates the healthcare facility to which the patient was discharged.
properties.name: dischargeToLocation

properties.documentation: The diagnosis(es) determined to be the reason for hospitalization at the time of discharge (this may be the same or different from the hospital admission diagnosis (added for Transition of Care).
properties.name: dischargeDiagnosis

class_definitions.documentation: Emergency is an encounter without a scheduled appointment and urgent clinical services are required.
class_definitions.name: EmergencyEncounter

properties.documentation: The release of a patient from a course of care.
properties.name: discharge

class_definitions.documentation: An interaction between a patient and a practitioner under the auspices of a given organization for the purpose of providing healthcare-related service(s). It is important to understand that if the there is a change in provider or organization, by definition a new encounter will be generated. For example, if a patient is moved from Surgery to Post-Op, a new encounter is generated. Similarly, if a patient receives care from 2 nurses while in Post-Op, there will be 2 encounters.
class_definitions.name: DetailedEncounter

properties.documentation: The patients account number in the context of the admitting or providing institution.
properties.name: accountId

properties.documentation: "Contains the account status." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-41. Note that HL7 does not suggest any values for this code (in User-defined Table 117).
properties.name: accountStatus

properties.documentation: "Contains the alternative, temporary, or pending optional visit ID number to be used if needed. Multiple alternate identifiers may be sent." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-50 Uniquely identifies this patient visit using an identification scheme other than the one used for the "id" property. This allows for different systems or organizations to assign different identifiers to the same visit.
properties.name: alternateVisitId

properties.documentation: "Indicates any permanent or transient handicapped conditions." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-15. Possible values include (from HL7 V2 Table 9): No functional limitations; Ambulates with assistive device; Wheelchair/stretcher bound; Comatose - non-responsive; Disoriented; Vision impaired; Hearing impaired; Speech impaired; Non-English speaking; Functional level unknown; Oxygen therapy; Special equipment (tubes, IVs, catheters); Amputee; Mastectomy; Paraplegic; Pregnant.
properties.name: ambulatoryStatus

properties.documentation: "Contains the code used to determine which price schedule is to be used for room and bed charges." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-21. Note that HL7 does not suggest any values for this code (in User-defined Table 32).
properties.name: chargePriceIndicator

properties.documentation: Describes the primary reason, in the patient's words, for the encounter/visit. This field contrasts with the reasonForVisit, which is the clinician's assessment of the reason for the encounter/visit.
properties.name: chiefComplaint

properties.documentation: Describes the encounter in terms of evaluation and management (e.g., diagnosis or procedure associated with the encounter). For example, Maintenance visit, 5 minutes or less.
properties.name: encounterBillingType

properties.documentation: "Contains the financial class(es) assigned to the patient for the purpose of identifying sources of reimbursement." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-20 Note that HL7 does not suggest any values for this code (in User-defined Table 64).
properties.name: financialClass

properties.documentation: "Contains the treatment or type of surgery that the patient is scheduled to receive." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-10. Possible Values (from HL7 Table 69) include: Cardiac Service, Medical Service, Pulmonary Service, Surgical Service, Urology Service.
properties.name: hospitalService

properties.documentation: "Specifies whether a patient's illness was job-related." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV2-15
properties.name: isEmploymentRelated

properties.documentation: ] Identifies the mode of transportation of the patients arrival, for example, ambulance, car, walking etc.
properties.name: modeOfArrival

properties.documentation: "This field is used by systems to categorize patients by site. It does not have a consistent industry-wide definition. It is subject to site specific variations." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-2. HL7 Version 2 has the following suggested values (table 4): Emergency; Inpatient; Outpatient; Preadmit; Recurring patient; Obstetrics; Commercial Account; Not Applicable; Unknown.
properties.name: patientClass

properties.documentation: "Contains site-specific values that identify the patient type." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-18 Note that HL7 does not suggest any values for this code (in User-defined Table 18).
properties.name: patientType

properties.documentation: "Contains the date of previous service for the same recurring condition. This may be a required field for billing certain illnesses (e.g., accident related) to a third party." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV2-14.
properties.name: previousServiceDate

properties.documentation: "Contains a user-defined code indicating what level of publicity is allowed for a specific visit." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV2-21. Possible values include (from HL7 V2 Table 215): Family only; No Publicity; Other; Unknown.
properties.name: publicityCode

properties.documentation: The reason for the encounter/visit from the clinician's point of view. This field contrasts with the chiefComplaint, which is the patient's description of the reason for the encounter/visit.
properties.name: reasonForVisit

properties.documentation: Identifies the source of the admission or encounter. In other words, identified where the patient was before being sent for this encounter. Possible values include: Community, Other facility, etc.
properties.name: referralSource

properties.documentation: "This field is used in a multiple facility environment, e.g., multiple campuses or buildings, to indicate the healthcare facility with which this visit is associated." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-39. Note that HL7 does not suggest any values for this code (in User-defined Table 115).
properties.name: servicingFacility

properties.documentation: A set of values representing the types of special arrangements provided or to be provided for this patient encounter (e.g., wheelchair, stretcher, interpreter, attendant, seeing eye dog)
properties.name: specialArrangements

properties.documentation: "Indicates whether the patient will be extended certain special courtesies." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-22. Note that HL7 does not suggest any values for this code (in User-defined Table 45).
properties.name: specialCourtesy

properties.documentation: Triage notes for the patient visit. Added for Public Health Reporting Initiative.
properties.name: triageNotes

properties.documentation: "This field contains the patient's initial assigned location or the location to which the patient is being moved. The first component may be the nursing station for inpatient locations, or clinic or department, for locations other than inpatient. For canceling a transaction or discharging a patient, the current location (after the cancellation event or before the discharge event) should be in this field." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-3
properties.name: assignedPatientLocation

properties.documentation: "Indicates the point of care, room, bed, healthcare facility ID, and bed status to which the patient may be moved. The first component may be the nursing station for inpatient locations, or the clinic, department, or home for locations other than inpatient." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-42
properties.name: pendingLocation

properties.documentation: "The location to which the patient is assigned. It is a role played by a place at which services may be provided. Note that a single physical place can play multiple service delivery location roles each with its own attributes. For example, a Podiatry clinic and Research clinic may meet on alternate days in the same physical location; each clinic uses its own mailing address and telephone number." (HL7)
properties.name: serviceDeliveryLocation

properties.documentation: "Contains a location other than the assigned location required for a temporary period of time (e.g., OR, operating theatre, etc.)." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-11
properties.name: temporaryLocation

properties.documentation: "This field is used to reflect the patient's temporary location (such as the operating room/theatre or x-ray) prior to a transfer from a temporary location to an actual location, or from a temporary location to another temporary location. The first component may be the nursing station for inpatient locations, or the clinic, department, or home for locations other than inpatient." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-43
properties.name: priorTemporaryLocation

properties.documentation: The location from which the patient came before admission
properties.name: origin

properties.documentation: An organization that is in charge of maintaining the information of this Encounter (e.g. who maintains the report or the master service catalog item, etc.). This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different. This MAY not be not the Service Delivery Location's Organization.
properties.name: serviceProvider

class_definitions.documentation: Patient is being treated "In-Home" for this encounter.
class_definitions.name: HomeBasePrimaryCareEncounter

class_definitions.documentation: A hospice encounter.
class_definitions.name: Hospice

class_definitions.documentation: Patient has been admitted to the facility and assigned a bed.
class_definitions.name: InpatientEncounter

properties.documentation: Contains the actual duration of the encounter. Note that the duration cannot be reliably calculated from the admission and discharge dates because of possible leaves of absence.
properties.name: lengthOfStay

class_definitions.documentation: A long term care encounter.
class_definitions.name: LongTermCare

class_definitions.documentation: A direct contact between a patient and a practitioner, to order or furnish hospital services for diagnosis or treatment of the patient, not resulting in formal hospitalization (an overnight stay as an admitted patient).
class_definitions.name: OutpatientVisit

properties.documentation: A categorization of the outpatient visit, based on the services provided and/or the circumstances under which the visit occurred. Possible values include: Ambulatory, In-Hospital (i.e., an patient made an "outpatient" visit while concurrently being an inpatient), Day Surgery, Observation, Nursing Home, Day Hospitalization, etc.
properties.name: serviceCategory

class_definitions.documentation: The Referral class is used to record and send details about a request for service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.
class_definitions.name: Referral

properties.documentation: An identifier to the composite request this is part of.
properties.name: groupIdentifier

properties.documentation: Actions requested as part of the referral
properties.name: serviceRequested

properties.documentation: The encounter that led to the referral.
properties.name: orginatingEncounter

properties.documentation: The clinical specialty (discipline) that the referral is requested for
properties.name: specialty

properties.documentation: Receiver of referral / transfer of care request
properties.name: recipient

properties.documentation: Additonal information to support referral or transfer of care request
properties.name: supportingInformation

class_definitions.documentation: An encounter that is similar to outpatient but the patient is admitted to a bed.
class_definitions.name: ShortStay

properties.documentation: Contains the actual duration of the encounter. Note that the duration cannot be reliably calculated from the admission and discharge dates because of possible leaves of absence.
properties.name: lengthOfStay

class_definitions.documentation: Represents medical services provided remotely, including telephone consultations and synchronous and asynchronous telehealth. Remote monitoring does not constitute a virtual encounter, but may trigger a virtual encounter if indicated by the situation.
class_definitions.name: VirtualEncounter

class_definitions.documentation: Documents the transfer of a patient from one location or responsible organization to another. Note that a transfer from one organization to another will, by definition, trigger a new encounter. A transfer from one location to another may trigger a new encounter depending on whether the responsible organization has changed. A movement from one bed within the same ward to another probably will not, but a movement from one ward to another probably would.
class_definitions.name: Transfer

properties.documentation: Categorizes the patient transfer. Possible values include Admission, Transfer, Discharge, etc.
properties.name: category

properties.documentation: The prior patient location if the patient is being transferred. This is null if the patient is new." - HL7 Version 2.8, PV1-6
properties.name: transferFromLocation

properties.documentation: The location to which the patient has been transferred.
properties.name: transferToLocation

class_definitions.documentation: An assertion is a finding that takes the form of a single coded concept, without an explicit measureable property. An assertion is used to express findings such as 'patient has diabetes' or 'patient has high blood pressure'. An assertion is not expressed as a {measureable property, measured value} pair; if the finding takes that form, EvaluationResult should be used. Note that EvaluationResults {eye color, blue} can sometimes be expressed as assertions and vice versa (blue eye color).
class_definitions.name: Assertion

properties.documentation: Date and time the assertion was made.
properties.name: dateAsserted

properties.documentation: The state of knowledge concerning the assertion; e.g., confirmed, refuted, provisional, suspected.
properties.name: verificationStatus

properties.documentation: The means by which a clinical finding is determined.
properties.name: findingMethod

class_definitions.documentation: An assertion about a clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept located on a specific body location that has risen to a level of concern.
class_definitions.name: FindingSiteAssertion

properties.documentation: The body site affected by a condition.
properties.name: findingSite

class_definitions.documentation: An assertion that represents a health condition of a patient that runs a clinical course over a period of time, and may be tracked during that time period.
class_definitions.name: ConditionAssertion

properties.documentation: Another clinical statement in the patient's record that is related to the current condition.
properties.name: associatedEntry

properties.documentation: The cause of the Clinical finding. This includes such causes as disease vectors and endogenous states (e.g., macular degeneration due to diabetes). Exogenous substances and forces should be captured as causative agent.
properties.name: dueTo

properties.documentation: Intensity of a symptom or condition. The criteria for this value differ by condition.
properties.name: severity

properties.documentation: Both the course and onset of a disease. Many conditions with an acute (sudden) onset also have an acute (short duration) course. Few diseases with a chronic (long - term) course would need to have their onset sub-divided into rapid or gradual subtypes, and thus there is no clear need for separating the rapidity of onset from the duration of a disease; based on testing by implementers and modelers, a single attribute with values that combine these meanings has clearly been more reproducible and useful than two attributes that attempt to separate the meanings.
properties.name: clinicalCourse

properties.documentation: Represents the history of episodes of care provided by a physician or other care provider for this condition.
properties.name: episodicity

properties.documentation: The physiological state of a condition that develops over time. Examples of disease phase include incubation period (exposed, asymptomatic), prodromal (symptoms but not full disease breakout), acute (full manifestation of disease), and convalescent.
properties.name: diseasePhase

properties.documentation: Physical observations captured by a clinician or subjective conditions experienced by a patient that are related to a medical condition.
properties.name: associatedSignAndSymptom

properties.documentation: The length of time from one occurrence to the next (e.g., intermittent, weekly, continuous).
properties.name: periodicity

properties.documentation: An action or intervention that makes a symptom less severe. Examples may include: rest, heat, ice, etc.
properties.name: alleviatingFactor

properties.documentation: An action or intervention which makes a symptom more severe.
properties.name: exacerbatingFactor

properties.documentation: The substance, medication, microorganism, force, or other agent that resulted in the condition described in this assertion.
properties.name: suspectedEntity

properties.documentation: For an assertion of a health condition, an indication of the status of the condition from the point of view of physiology or clinical diagnostic process. Values may typically include: Active, Relapse, Remission, Resolved, Confirmed, Ruled out, Unknown.
properties.name: clinicalStatus

class_definitions.documentation: Measurement resulted from a laboratory.
class_definitions.name: LaboratoryTestResult

properties.documentation: The service completing the observations, e.g. biochemistry, microbiology, blood bank, etc.
properties.name: diagnosticService

properties.documentation: The specimen used for the analysis.
properties.name: specimen

properties.documentation: Indicates whether this result was from point-of-care testing (POCT).
properties.name: poctIndicator

class_definitions.documentation: Measurement resulting from a physical assessment procedure.
class_definitions.name: PhysicalEvaluationResult

properties.documentation: Captures the post-coordinated location on the body where the characteristic was observed.
properties.name: bodyLocation

class_definitions.documentation: The outcome of an evaluation of a characteristic. This model holds a "question" in the key and holds a value in the result. This value is further qualified through the model's properties.
class_definitions.name: EvaluationResult

properties.documentation: If the result value is missing, a code explaining the reason the result cannot be provided.
properties.name: exceptionValue

properties.documentation: The means by which a measurement, evaluation, or assessment was made.
properties.name: method

properties.documentation: The device used to evaluate the characteristic such as the type of blood pressure cuff used on a patient.
properties.name: device

properties.documentation: Sequence is a number placed onto the data which refers to the order it occurred in or needs to be retrieved by.
properties.name: sequence

properties.documentation: Flag indicating whether there was a significant change from previous results.
properties.name: deltaFlag

properties.documentation: The range for the measurement.
properties.name: referenceRange

properties.documentation: The evaluation procedure that is the source of the evaluation result.
properties.name: evaluationProcedure

properties.documentation: Describes the previously existing conditions or states that could affect a measurement or assessment, for example, a patient's weight taken while clothed, height with or without shoes, blood pressure taken while standing or lying down. Precondition aligns with the SNOMED CT Observable model attribute 704326004 |Precondition (attribute)|
properties.name: precondition

properties.documentation: Date the result of was produced from the evaluation or laboratory test.
properties.name: evaluationDate

properties.documentation: Interval of time when the measurement result holds.
properties.name: validityPeriod

class_definitions.documentation: Specialization of Procedure that represents a procedure performed on a collected specimen such as a blood panel or a biopsy.
class_definitions.name: LaboratoryProcedure

properties.documentation: A code indicating the type of laboratory procedure performed.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: Tissues, objects, or samples taken from the patient during the procedure including biopsies, aspiration fluid, or other samples sent for pathological analysis.
properties.name: specimen

properties.documentation: A result of the laboratory procedure, such as an absolution neutrophil count (ANC).
properties.name: finding

properties.documentation: Device used for the laboratory procedure.
properties.name: device

class_definitions.documentation: The specific instance of the procedure in which the specimen was obtained.
class_definitions.name: SpecimenCollection

properties.documentation:
A coded value specifying the body site, used to approach the target site during the collection procedure, if different from target site.
EXAMPLE(S): Liver biopsy is obtained via a percutaneous needle, the approach site would be the point of entry of the needle.
properties.name: approachBodySite

properties.documentation:
The code representing the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected (if subject is a human or animal subject).
EXAMPLE(S): lung, liver, femur
NOTE: This element is not used for environmental specimens.
properties.name: targetBodySite

properties.documentation: The specimen collected.
properties.name: collectedSpecimen

properties.documentation: The amount of time the collection was delayed from the requested date/time of the order.
properties.name: delay

properties.documentation: The number of times that a collection was attempted for the Order related to this collection.
properties.name: repetitionNumber

properties.documentation: The geographical location or health care facility location where the specimen was collected. For samples taken from the environment, source location could be the room where a surface swab was taken or geographic location where a soil sample was obtained.
properties.name: sourceLocation

class_definitions.documentation: The topic for surgical procedures, independent of whether the surgery was proposed, ordered, performed, not performed, etc.
class_definitions.name: SurgicalProcedure

properties.documentation: The site where the procedure is performed such as the removal of a cyst.
properties.name: site

properties.documentation: The directional, relational, or spatial access to the site of a surgical procedure, e.g., intranasal approach.
properties.name: surgicalApproach

properties.documentation: The route used to access the site of a procedure. It is used to distinguish open, closed, and percutaneous procedures.
properties.name: access

properties.documentation: The instrument or equipment used to access the site of a procedure.
properties.name: usingAccessDevice

properties.documentation: The instrument or equipment utilized to execute an action
properties.name: usingDevice

class_definitions.documentation: Procedure performed on a device such as the insertion or removal of an implant or the cleaning or repair of an implemented device.
class_definitions.name: SurgicalProcedureOnDevice

properties.documentation: The device on which the procedure directly acts such as the removal of stents.
properties.name: directDevice

properties.documentation: Device when the action is done on something that is located in or on a device, but is not done directly on the device itself.
properties.name: indirectDevice

class_definitions.documentation: Experimental class for an imaging procedure. Note that this class is still incomplete at this time.
class_definitions.name: ImagingProcedure

properties.documentation: The site where the procedure is applied.
properties.name: site

properties.documentation: Substance used for this imaging procedure such as a contrast agent.
properties.name: usingSubstance

class_definitions.documentation:
Action intended to modify an existing action such as a request to discontinue the administration of a medication or a proposal to cancel an existing order.
Experimental
class_definitions.name: ModifyTargetAction

properties.documentation: The target action that this topic modifies.
properties.name: targetAction

class_definitions.documentation: Processing step performed on a specimen.
class_definitions.name: SpecimenProcessing

properties.documentation:
Substance added to a specimen for preservation or to aid in the process as required by the procedure.
EXAMPLE(s): Anticoagulant, Separator, stabilizer
properties.name: additive

properties.documentation:
Coded representation of the state of the processing step in the procedure.
EXAMPLE(S): completed, in progress, scheduled
properties.name: status

properties.documentation: The temperature at which the processing occurred.
properties.name: temperature

properties.documentation: The specimen processed by this procedure.
properties.name: specimen

class_definitions.documentation: A physical evaluation assessment performed on a patient such as review of systems, or taking vital signs at the doctor's office.
class_definitions.name: PhysicalEvaluation

properties.documentation: The device or devices used to perform the physical evaluation such as using a blood pressure cuff when taking a patient's blood pressure.
properties.name: device

class_definitions.documentation: Context indicating the known absence of a finding in the subject of information. If the finding is suspected to be absent, use the known or suspected present context instead.
class_definitions.name: Absent

class_definitions.documentation: The ActionContext class provides the context for the ProcedureTopic of a clinical statement. For instance, a statement about a procedure may specify that the procedure has been proposed, ordered, planned, performed or possibly not performed. This class aligns with the SNOMED Situations with Explicit Context.
class_definitions.name: ActionContext

properties.documentation: Reason the action was done or justification for the action. Reasons may also be specified for not performing an action.
properties.name: justification

properties.documentation: The latest recorded status of an action within the specified context. An action may be interpretable within a specific context such as whether it is planned, ordered, or performed. Moreover, within each of these contexts, an action may have a set of allowable states in which it can exist. For instance, a proposal may be rejected or an order may be signed, canceled or superceded by another order.
properties.name: currentStatus

properties.documentation: Indicates the scope or clinical setting where the context applies, e.g., Inpatient, outpatient, community.
properties.name: scope

properties.documentation: Additional information that supports the performance, non-performance, ordering, or proposing of the clinical action, for example, the patient height and weight, or documentation of heart rate before administering the medication (in case medication needs to be held if heart rate falls in a specific range).
properties.name: supportingInformation

class_definitions.documentation: The FindingContext class provides the context for the EvaluationResult and Assertion topics of a clinical statement. For instance, a statement about findings may state that the finding was observed present or absent. This class aligns with the SNOMED Situation with Explicit Context.
class_definitions.name: FindingContext

properties.documentation: The last recorded state of the finding, indicating whether the finding is preliminary, amended, final, to be attained, etc.
properties.name: status

class_definitions.documentation: A context indicating that a finding is known or suspected to be present in the subject of information.
class_definitions.name: KnownOrSuspectedPresent

properties.documentation: Represents a qualitative probability for the presence of the condition, such as unlikely, highly likely, etc.
properties.name: certainty

class_definitions.documentation: A record that a clinical act was initiated by not completed.
class_definitions.name: NonCompletion

properties.documentation: The original scheduled time for the action planned for execution.
properties.name: nonCompletionTimeframe

class_definitions.documentation: A record that a clinical act was not performed and/or never initiated. Do not use this context if the act was initiated or started but aborted or cancelled. Use the NotPerformed context instead.
class_definitions.name: NonPerformance

properties.documentation: The time period during which the act had been intended for execution.
properties.name: scheduledPerformanceTime

class_definitions.documentation: An instruction by a healthcare provider to another healthcare provider to perform some act.
class_definitions.name: Order

properties.documentation: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author. It could be the identifier of a requisition or prescription that contains orders for a set of medications, each individual medication order having the identifier of the parent order.
properties.name: groupIdentifier

properties.documentation: The proposal that is partly or wholly fulfilled by the performance of this act.
properties.name: basedOn

properties.documentation: Identifies the ordering provider's instructions to the patient or to the provider on how to deliver or comply with the ordered procedure.
properties.name: patientInstructions

properties.documentation: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.
properties.name: priorRequest

class_definitions.documentation: A context indicating the actual performance or execution of a healthcare-related action, e.g., administration of the third dose of Hepatitis B vaccine on Dec 4th 2012, or an appendectomy performed today.
class_definitions.name: Performance

properties.documentation: The party that performed the action.
properties.name: performed

properties.documentation: The plan that is partly or wholly enacted by the performance of this act.
properties.name: enactsPlan

properties.documentation: The order that is partly or wholly enacted by the performance of this act.
properties.name: fulfillsOrder

properties.documentation: The proposal that is partly or wholly fulfilled by the performance of this act.
properties.name: basedOn

properties.documentation: The duration of time the action was performed.
properties.name: duration

properties.documentation: A larger action of which this particular action is a component or step.
properties.name: partOf

class_definitions.documentation: A record indicating an action in the planning phase. Typically, this would include a time at which the action is scheduled to be performed.
class_definitions.name: Plan

properties.documentation: Information about who planned the action, when they planned it, etc...
properties.name: planned

properties.documentation: The order that is partly or wholly enacted by the performance of this act.
properties.name: fulfillsOrder

properties.documentation: The proposal that is partly or wholly fulfilled by the performance of this act.
properties.name: basedOn

properties.documentation: The time when the action is expected to be performed.
properties.name: expectedPerformanceTime

properties.documentation: Persons who are expected to or intended to perform this action, e.g., the person who will perform the surgery.
properties.name: expectedPerformer

class_definitions.documentation: An order from the perspective of a fulfillment system.
class_definitions.name: Promise

properties.documentation: Information about who made the promise, when did they make it, how was it conveyed, etc...
properties.name: promised

properties.documentation: The order that is partly or wholly enacted by the performance of this act.
properties.name: fulfillsOrder

properties.documentation: The method the provider used to communicate to the user to take action on the order. Examples include: written, telephoned, verbal, electronically entered, etc.
properties.name: orderModality

properties.documentation: This is the date the order was discontinued.
properties.name: orderDiscontinueDate

class_definitions.documentation: An offer or a suggestion to perform a healthcare act. A recommendation to a provider is an example of proposal made by a CDS system. A proposal must be accepted by an entity in order for it to be performed.
class_definitions.name: Proposal

class_definitions.documentation: Concept represents a recommendation from a clinical decision support system or advice from a consultation to not perform an act.
class_definitions.name: ProposalAgainst

properties.documentation: Information about who made the proposal against the performance of a particular action, when it was made, how it was conveyed, etc...
properties.name: requested

properties.documentation: The time period during which the act should not be performed. If omitted, the implication is that the act should not be performed, ever.
properties.name: validityPeriod

class_definitions.documentation: Compositional and reusable grouping of clinical statement attributes that provides the context for the topic of a clinical statement. The StatementContext class aligns with the SNOMED CT Situations with Explicit Context. The StatementContext provides the expressivity required to specify that an act was performed or not performed or that a finding was asserted to be present or absent for the given subject of information. It also often holds provenance information relevant to the context of the clinical statement. It is important to note that by default the context applies to the conjunction of the attribute specified in the statement. For instance, if a clinical statement has a topic describing a rash on left arm and a context of 'absent', then the statement states that the subject of interest did not have a rash on the left arm but might have had one on the right arm.
class_definitions.name: StatementContext

properties.documentation:
The ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc. Attribute aligns with the SNOMED CT Situation with Explicit Context (SWEC) Concept Model context attributes: 'Finding context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408729009) and 'Procedure context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408730004).
The range allowed for this attribute shall be consistent with the SNOMED CT concept model specification for SWEC.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: Whether the topic is prospective or retrospective. E.g., action occurred in the past. This attribute is aligned with the SNOMED Situation With Explicit Context temporal context attribute.
properties.name: temporalContext

class_definitions.documentation: A request by a healthcare provider or system to another healthcare provider or system to perform some action.
class_definitions.name: Request

properties.documentation: Information about the ordering of the action such as who made the request, when the request was made, how it was made, etc...
properties.name: requested

properties.documentation: Indicates the type of the request that is made, for example, to initiate an action, to suspend an ongoing activity, to discontinue an ongoing activity, or to cancel an existing request.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: Persons who are expected to or intended to perform this action, e.g., the person who will perform the surgery.
properties.name: expectedPerformer

properties.documentation: How quickly the action must be initiated. Includes concepts such as stat, urgent, routine.
properties.name: priority

properties.documentation: The proposed timing for the request.
properties.name: timing

class_definitions.documentation: Context associated with non-clinical events such as floods, accidents, and tornadoes.
class_definitions.name: EventContext

class_definitions.documentation: Base class for contexts asserting presence or absence of a finding.
class_definitions.name: PresenceAbsenceContext

class_definitions.documentation: Clinical statement context for a goal.
class_definitions.name: GoalContext

properties.documentation: Identifies the mutually agreed level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the goal.
properties.name: priority

properties.documentation: The date or event after which the goal should begin being pursued.
properties.name: start

properties.documentation: Indicates who established the goal (rather than the subject who is to pursue the goal).
properties.name: expressedBy

properties.documentation: Indicates a category the goal falls within, for example, dietary, safety, behavioral, nursing, physiotherapy.
properties.name: category

properties.documentation: Human-readable and optionally coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".
properties.name: objectiveOfCare

properties.documentation: Indicates when goal should be reached.
properties.name: targetDate

properties.documentation: The identified conditions and other health record elements that are intended to be addressed by the goal.
properties.name: addresses

properties.documentation: Identifies the change (or lack of change) at the point when the status of the goal is assessed.
properties.name: outcomeCode

properties.documentation: Details of what's changed (or not changed).
properties.name: outcomeReference

class_definitions.documentation: The context to express an assertion of absence, within the current limits of knowledge. Typically, this context is used for allergy and intolerance statements where no known drug allergy implies that there might be a medication the patient is allergic to, but it has thus far not been encountered.
class_definitions.name: NoKnown

class_definitions.documentation: A context class indicating the known or suspected presence of a condition or characteristic in the subject of information.
class_definitions.name: AssertionKnownOrSuspectedPresent

properties.documentation: Date when the asserted finding began manifesting or was first observed. This property may have a broad precision (e.g., a year rather than a date).
properties.name: dateOfOnset

properties.documentation: The age of the patient or subject at onset of the Condition. Note that this property could potentially be derived.
properties.name: ageAtOnset

properties.documentation: Date when the asserted finding abated. This property may have a broad precision (e.g., a year rather than a date).
properties.name: dateAbated

properties.documentation: Flag indicating whether a condition has abated when a specific date of, time period, or age at abatement is not known.
properties.name: hasAbated

properties.documentation: PresentOnAdmission is used to indicate if a finding or other characteristic existed upon admission. Wound, IV, dressing, bruise etc.
properties.name: presentOnAdmission

class_definitions.documentation: Description of a healthcare action, independent of action context.
class_definitions.name: ProcedureTopic

properties.documentation: An account of the procedure in narrative form.
properties.name: description

properties.documentation: The reason for performing this act.
properties.name: reason

properties.documentation: Technique or way of accomplishing the act, e.g., endoscopic, arthroscopic, etc.
properties.name: method

properties.documentation: Patient state or condition that must be true prior to the performance of the procedure such as 'at rest', 'supine', 'fasting', etc.
properties.name: precondition

class_definitions.documentation: An non-clinical event such as a natural disaster. Topic allows the capture of information related to such events when they pertain to the clinical context associated with a given patient.
class_definitions.name: EventTopic

class_definitions.documentation: The base topic class for assertions and evaluation results that result from medical investigations or diagnostics, independent of the context of the result being present, absent, or hypothetical (as in the case of a goal).
class_definitions.name: FindingTopic

properties.documentation: The value of the finding, typically a quantity for measurements and a concept code for qualitative evaluations and assertions. In general, any data type can be the value of a finding.
properties.name: result

properties.documentation: An optional description of the finding in human narrative form.
properties.name: description
