properties.documentation: Audio, visual, or other binary content produced during the evaluation, such as an X-ray.
properties.name: multimedia

properties.documentation: A clinical judgment concerning the significance or impact of the finding with respect to its subject (e.g., the patient).
properties.name: interpretation

class_definitions.documentation: Compositional and reusable grouping of clinical statement attributes that make up the clinical focus of the statement. StatementTopic class attributes are aligned with SNOMED CT Concept Model attributes when such an overlap exists. Note that this class does not include contextual attributes such as the nature of the action (ordered, proposed, planned, etc...), the nature of the patient state being described (e.g., present, suspected present, absent), and the attribution of this information (the who, when, where, how, why of the information recorded).
class_definitions.name: StatementTopic

properties.documentation: The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement. For actions, the key represents the action being described. For findings, the key represents the "question" or property being investigated. For evaluation result findings, the key contains a concept for an observable entity, such as systolic blood pressure. For assertion findings (which by nature lack an explicit question), the key contains a default concept signifying that an assertion is being made. In all cases, the key describes the topic independent of the context of the action or the finding.
properties.name: key

class_definitions.documentation: This resource identifies an instance or a type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The device may be a medical or non-medical device. Medical devices includes durable (reusable) medical equipment, implantable devices, as well as disposable equipment used for diagnostic, treatment, and research for healthcare and public health. Non-medical devices may include items such as a machine, cellphone, computer, application, etc.
class_definitions.name: ClinicalDevice

properties.documentation: Whether the device is available for use, currently in use, out of use, etc.
properties.name: status

properties.documentation: The organization responsible for the provision and/or ongoing maintenance of the device.
properties.name: owner

properties.documentation: Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device.
properties.name: contact

class_definitions.documentation: A class representing a medication, either a prescription drug or over-the-counter drug (potentially including vitamins, herbal remedies, and dietary supplements) that is used to prevent, treat, or relieve symptoms of a disease or abnormal condition. It covers the ingredients and the packaging for a medication.
class_definitions.name: Medication

properties.documentation: The medication concept that represents this medication.
properties.name: code

properties.documentation: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use. This status is not intended to specify if the medication is part of a formulary.
properties.name: status

properties.documentation: Describes the details of the manufacturer of the medication product. This is not intended to represent the distributor of a medication product.
properties.name: manufacturer

properties.documentation: The medication form such as tablet, capsule, ampoule, etc...
properties.name: form

properties.documentation: Specific amount of the drug in the packaged product, for example, 20 tablets. When specifying a product, e.g., insulin glargine 100 unit per mL solution for injection, this attribute provides additional clarification of the packaged amount (for example, 3 mL, 10mL, etc).
properties.name: amount

properties.documentation: Active and/or inactive ingredient
properties.name: ingredient

properties.documentation: The assigned lot number of a batch associated with the specified product.
properties.name: batchLotNumber

properties.documentation: When this specific batch of product will expire.
properties.name: batchExpirationDate

class_definitions.documentation: A specimen is a substance, physical object, or collection of objects, that the laboratory considers a single discrete, uniquely identified unit that is the subject of one or more steps in the laboratory workflow. A specimen may include multiple physical pieces as long as they are considered a single unit within the laboratory workflow. A specimen results from one to many specimen collection procedures, and may be contained in multiple specimen containers. Specimen may have one or more processing activities.
class_definitions.name: Specimen

properties.documentation: Specimen identifier of the specimen from which the current specimen was derived .
properties.name: parentSpecimenIdentifier

properties.documentation: Coded representation of the general category of the specimen, for example, environmental, food, or biologic product.
properties.name: classCode

properties.documentation: Coded representation of the precise nature of the entity that will be the source material for the observation, e.g., stool, tissue, blood, CSF
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: Coded representation of lower level categorization of the specimen. In Clinical Genomics, there is a need to identify specific subtypes such as somatic or germline samples.
properties.name: subtype

properties.documentation: This field contains any known or suspected specimen hazards, e.g., exceptionally infectious agent, blood from a hepatitis patient, BioSafetyLevel (BSL), flammable, radioactive.
properties.name: risk

properties.documentation: Coded representation of how the specimen and/or container need to be handled from the time of collection through the initiation of testing, e.g., keep frozen, do not allow contact with water
properties.name: handling

properties.documentation:
Flag to note that the current specimen is derived from another specimen. Derivation procedure will be indicated by the SpecimenProcessingActivity processingProcedure code.
Conformance Statement - if the "Is derived" flag is checked, the parentSpecimenIdentifer attribute for this specimen (see second entry in this table) must be filled out.
properties.name: isDerived

properties.documentation: Coded representation specifying the state and nature of the material, e.g., solid, liquid, gas, tablet, ointment, gel
properties.name: form

properties.documentation: Coded representation of the purpose of the sample as related to the analytical procedure being performed, e.g., reference sample, proficiency sample, QC sample, clinical.
properties.name: role

properties.documentation: The initial volume, mass or size of the specimen.
properties.name: originalMeasurement

properties.documentation: The amount of specimen currently available for use in further testing.
properties.name: currentMeasurement

properties.documentation: A mode or state of being that describes the nature of the specimen, for example, hemolyzed or clotted.
properties.name: condition

properties.documentation: A concept used to indicate freedom from contaminants of a given specimen. Note that this attribute is only needed in certain domains, for example in bio-banking.
properties.name: purity

properties.documentation: Numeric value describing the abundance of the specimen constituent divided by the total volume of a mixture. Note that this attribute is only needed in certain domains, for example in bio-banking.
properties.name: concentration

properties.documentation: Numeric value used to verify receipt of specimens.
properties.name: numberOfContainers

properties.documentation: Coded representation of the purpose or role of a derived specimen with respect to its parent, for example, aliquot, block for tissue sections from a specimen, or slide from a block.
properties.name: childRole

properties.documentation: The date after which the specimen is no longer viable, typically a set period after the collection time.
properties.name: expiration

properties.documentation: The number of individual specimens of a particular type represented by this instance of a specimen. For example, samples from 25 animals in a cattle herd are collected.
properties.name: groupCount

properties.documentation: Information about the collection procedure performed to obtain the specimen.
properties.name: collectionProcedure

properties.documentation: The specimen processing activity applied on this specimen.
properties.name: processingActivity

properties.documentation: The container(s) holding this specimen.
properties.name: container

class_definitions.documentation: A homogeneous material with a definite composition.
class_definitions.name: Substance

properties.documentation: The concept that represents this substance.
properties.name: code

properties.documentation: A code that classifies the general type of substance. This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.
properties.name: category

properties.documentation: A constituent material of the substance.
properties.name: ingredient

class_definitions.documentation:
Physical object that touches and holds specimen.
EXAMPLES: slide, tube, box, jar
class_definitions.name: SpecimenContainer

properties.documentation: A non-unique textual identifier for the specimen container, e.g., screwcap jar, blood tube, slide, paraffin block.
properties.name: name

properties.documentation: Coded representation of the categorization of a container, e.g., screw jar top, serum tube, slide.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: Coded representation of the material composition of the container, e.g., codes for glass, plastic, metal.
properties.name: material

properties.documentation: Coded representation of the type of container cap, e.g., red top, tiger top, purple, blue. Container caps may be used to identify differences in container attributes to facilitate tracking and processing.
properties.name: cap

properties.documentation: Substances introduced in order to preserve, maintain or enhance the particular nature or component of the specimen, e.g., formalin, Citrate, EDTA
properties.name: additive

properties.documentation: A textual note or description regarding discrepancies or anomalies observed about a container, e.g., cap not sealed, label not firmly attached, tube received broken.
properties.name: condition

properties.documentation: Placement of the identifier on or in the container.
properties.name: identifierLocation

properties.documentation: Distance from the Point of Reference to the separator material (barrier) within the container in units specified below, e.g., serum gel tube, tubes that are being centrifuged.
properties.name: barrierDelta

properties.documentation: Thickness of the container at the bottom of the container. For instance, adjustment to make to the drop distance based on the container parameter (tube height) and the thickness of the container wall at the bottom - idea is to not break the tip off the pipette.
properties.name: bottomDelta

properties.documentation: The maximum amount of a substance or number of physical objects that a container can hold. For tubes this is draw volume, for tissue micro array slides it could be the number of wells.
properties.name: capacity

properties.documentation: The longest horizontal measurement of an object.
properties.name: length

properties.documentation: Distance from side to side, measuring across the object at right angles to the length.
properties.name: width

properties.documentation: The measurement of vertical distance.
properties.name: height

properties.documentation: The distance across a circle. Applies only to cylindrical containers.
properties.name: diameter

properties.documentation: Boolean indicating if the identifier is placed inside the container material.
properties.name: identifierEmbedded

properties.documentation: Equipment needed to read the identifier on the container such as barcode scanner, chip reader, if all else fails human
properties.name: identifierReaderType

properties.documentation: Defines the row and column layout for the container. For instance, available positions for specimen on a slide (4 quadrant slide).
properties.name: configuration

properties.documentation: material in a fluid collection container that facilities the separation of cellular or solid material from liquid, e.g., SST, buffy cell layer
properties.name: separatorType

class_definitions.documentation: A material component in a substance, represented by a code, substance, or medication.
class_definitions.name: Ingredient

properties.documentation: A code that specifies the type of the ingredient.
properties.name: itemCode

properties.documentation: If the ingredient is a non-medication substance, the specification of that substance.
properties.name: substance

properties.documentation: If the ingredient is a medication, the specification of that medication ingredient.
properties.name: medication

properties.documentation: The amount of an ingredient in a mixture, expressed as a ratio. For example, 250 mg per tabet is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250 mg and the denominator is 1 tablet.
properties.name: amount

properties.documentation: Flag indicating whether the ingredient is an active ingredient in a formulation.
properties.name: isActive

class_definitions.documentation: An organization involved in the provision of health related services.
class_definitions.name: HealthCareOrganization

properties.documentation: An accreditation of the organization, for example, licensure or certification as a skilled nursing facility or assisted living facility.
properties.name: accreditation

class_definitions.documentation: A location in a health care facility.
class_definitions.name: HealthCareFacilityLocation

properties.documentation: The room at the specified location and floor, e.g., Room 102
properties.name: room

properties.documentation: The bed at the specified location, floor, and room, e.g., Bed 2
properties.name: bed

properties.documentation: The floor at the specified location, e.g., 10th Floor
properties.name: floor

properties.documentation: A designation for the building at the specified location, for example, the name of the building or facility.
properties.name: building

class_definitions.documentation: Association class used to represent the relationship between a class and one or more clinical statements where the relationship is qualified by one or more attributes.
class_definitions.name: InformationEntryAssociation

properties.documentation: The statements to be associated with the current information item.
properties.name: target

properties.documentation: The type of association between the source and the target.
properties.name: type

class_definitions.documentation: A digital signature along with supporting context. The signature may be electronic/cryptographic in nature, or a graphical image representing a hand-written signature, or a signature process. Different Signature approaches have different utilities.
class_definitions.name: Signature

properties.documentation: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.
properties.name: reason

properties.documentation: When the digital signature was signed.
properties.name: when

properties.documentation: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed (e.g. the signature used their private key).
properties.name: who

properties.documentation: The party represented by the actual participant, for example, a person signing for an organization, or a parent signing a consent document for a minor.
properties.name: onBehalfOf

properties.documentation: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jwt for JWT, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.
properties.name: mimeType

properties.documentation: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.
properties.name: signatureContent

class_definitions.documentation:
Attribution provides a formal pattern and reusable structure for attributes of a record that describes an activity in a process involved in producing, delivering or otherwise influencing the entry in a record. Attribution provides a critical foundation for assessing authenticity, enabling trust, and allowing reproducibility. Provenance assertions are a form of contextual metadata and can themselves become important records with their own provenance. Provenance statement indicates clinical significance in terms of confidence in authenticity, reliability, and trustworthiness, integrity, and stage in lifecycle (e.g. Document Completion - has the artifact been legally authenticated), all of which may impact security, privacy, and trust policies.
Attribution provides a common reference model pattern that may be included directly within a clinical statement (e.g., the metadata associated with the recording of a clinical statement in a system) or within the Provenance pattern when it is preferrable to have such information external to but referencing the clinical statement (see Provenance). Note that, when included directly within a clinical statement, updates made to attribution attribute values will result in a versioning change in the instance. When part of the Provenance class, updates to provenance do not result in an update of the clinical statement referenced by the Provenance class (see Provenance.target).
class_definitions.name: Attribution

properties.documentation: The activity that is to be attributed to a party, for example, asserting, recording, verifying, consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, or using. When a model attribute whose type is Attribution specifies the activity, such as "recorder", the activity attribute must match the intent of the attribute.
properties.name: activity

properties.documentation: The time at which the activity was recorded.
properties.name: recordedOn

properties.documentation: The person or entity capturing the attribution information.
properties.name: recordedBy

properties.documentation: The period during which the activity occurred.
properties.name: activityTimeRange

properties.documentation: The reason that the activity was taking place.
properties.name: reason

properties.documentation: Where the activity occurred, if relevant.
properties.name: location

properties.documentation: Policy or plan that defines the activity. Typically, a single activity may have multiple applicable policy documents, such as patient consent, guarantor funding, etc.
properties.name: policy

properties.documentation: A person, entity, or other party responsible for execution of some facet of the activity.
properties.name: participant

properties.documentation: A digital signature on the target Reference(s). The signer should match a Attribution.participant. The purpose of the signature is indicated.
properties.name: signature

properties.documentation: This component captures the method used to perform the activity. For instance, in Verified, it captures how verification is achieved (verbal, written, telephone, etc.).
properties.name: method

class_definitions.documentation:
The Provenance pattern supports the attachment of attribution information to one or more clinical statements and is not part of the clinical statements themselves.
The attachment of provenance information to a clinical statement in this manner does not impact the versioning of the clinical statement target since attribution information is external to the statement.
class_definitions.name: Provenance

properties.documentation: The activity provenance details. Refer to the Attribution class.
properties.name: attribution

properties.documentation: The clinical statement that were generated or updated by the activity described. A provenance can point to more than one target if multiple resources were created/updated by the same activity.
properties.name: target

class_definitions.documentation: Context associated with the performance of an educational intervention.
class_definitions.name: PatientEducationPerformance

properties.documentation: This property may be used to summarize an oral communication with the Patient.
properties.name: oralCommunicationSummary

properties.documentation: The percent of the course or session that was performed.
properties.name: percentComplete

properties.documentation: A qualitative assessment of how well the Patient (or Patient's representative) understood the material presented. Example values include: Poor, Fair, Good, Group - no assessment, Refused, etc.
properties.name: levelOfUnderstanding

properties.documentation: Amount of time spent performing the education intervention.
properties.name: professionalTime

properties.documentation: This property contains the contents of any written materials (usually personalized materials) provided to the Patient. This property may also be used to summarize an oral communication with the Patient. Note that the identification of pre-defined materials should be accomplished using the educationalMaterialsProvided property rather than reproducing the content of such materials here.
properties.name: textProvided

class_definitions.documentation: This class captures information about counselling or education provided to (or an attempt to provide to) the Patient or to the Patient's representative and provides a means to note how well the Patient understood the information provided. Patient Education may be in the form of written instructions - either pre-defined materials, or personalized instructions - as well as oral counseling.
class_definitions.name: PatientRelatedEducation

properties.documentation: Cognitive or sensory barriers to receiving counseling.
properties.name: educationBarrier

properties.documentation: The communication method used to provide the patient counseling.
properties.name: educationMethod

properties.documentation: This property identifies any pre-defined written materials provided to the Patient. In many cases, Patient Education is accomplished by the provision of standardized materials produced based on the Patient's condition or based on a Procedure that the Patient has undergone. For example, there is a standardized Discharge Instructions for Diverticulitis. Use this property to identify any pre-printed materials provided to the patient. Use the textProvided property to identify any other personalized instructions.
properties.name: predefinedEducationalMaterial

properties.documentation: This property contains the contents of any written materials (usually personalized materials) provided to the Patient.
properties.name: personalizedEducationMaterial

properties.documentation: Pointer to the location at which the patient education or counseling was provided or is to be provided.
properties.name: location

properties.documentation: The organization providing this service.
properties.name: providingOrganization

class_definitions.documentation:
An entry in the patient record documenting an untoward or unexpected finding observed during the course of an activity or an activity.
Adverse events may capture either a workflow breach that may or may not result in harm but that must be documented for quality improvement purposes or an adverse finding whether or not it can be traceable to an actual workflow breach.
class_definitions.name: AdverseEventEntry

properties.documentation: An account or explanation of the adverse event in narrative.
properties.name: description

properties.documentation: Any documentation supplied when documenting this event.
properties.name: referenceDocumentation

properties.documentation: Relevant medical history for documentation purposes.
properties.name: relevantMedicalHistory

properties.documentation: Attribution metadata relevant to the reporting of an act or finding not already captured in the associated act or finding statement.
properties.name: reported

properties.documentation: Clinical significance of the adverse event, usually associated with events that pose a threat to a patient's life or functioning. Seriousness serves as a primary guide for determining regulatory reporting obligations.
properties.name: seriousness

properties.documentation: Used when one needs to indicate that the adverse event occurred relative to an other event. For instance, it can be used to indicate that an infection was acquired within some time interval post hospital admission.
properties.name: timing

class_definitions.documentation: An AdverseFinding is any unexpected clinical finding in a patient in the course of care or clinical investigation subject which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with a specific intervention.
class_definitions.name: AdverseFindingAdverseEvent

properties.documentation: The adverse finding(s) reported.
properties.name: reportedFinding

properties.documentation: Associated diagnosis in cases where the reported findings are signs and symptoms and a diagnosis has been made. For instance, the reported findings may be nausea and vomiting and the associated diagnosis may be toxicity resulting from an administered substance.
properties.name: associatedDiagnosis

properties.documentation: The last action performed prior to observing the adverse finding. Note that this action may not be directly related to the adverse finding itself as the adverse finding may have been causally related to a previous step in a chain of events and only observed later in the workflow.
properties.name: identifiedDuringActivity

properties.documentation: The protocol breach associated with this adverse finding if known and documented.
properties.name: associatedActivity

properties.documentation: Concept should specify whether the relationship between the adverse finding and the reported activity is 'temporal - no causality', 'temporal - causality not established' or 'causal'.
properties.name: activityAssociationType

class_definitions.documentation: A reported activity associated with though not necessarily causal to an adverse event.
class_definitions.name: ReportedActivity

properties.documentation: The activity which represents a breach of protocol.
properties.name: reportedActivity

class_definitions.documentation: An AdverseFinding is any unexpected clinical finding in a patient documented as part of a clinical investigation which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with a specific study intervention. For instance, a study participant developing a fever during the course of the study.
class_definitions.name: ClinicalStudyAdverseFinding

properties.documentation: The clinical study during which the clinical finding is observed and documented.
properties.name: associatedClinicalStudy

properties.documentation: A code indicating the timing of reporting requirements for this adverse finding based on its seriousness, e.g., 24 hours, 5 business days, 1 month, etc.
properties.name: notificationRequirement

class_definitions.documentation: An entry in an adverse event report documenting an event that may result in harm to a subject and which must be documented.
class_definitions.name: AdverseEventReportEntry

properties.documentation: A reference to an entry in the patient record that documents the adverse event.
properties.name: adverseEvent

class_definitions.documentation: An undesired activity or breach of protocol, regardless of whether it resulted in harm to the subject, which must be documented.
class_definitions.name: WorkflowBreachAdverseEvent

properties.documentation: The activity that should have or was being performed when the workflow breach occurred.
properties.name: expectedActivity

properties.documentation: The finding that resulted from the reported activity.
properties.name: outcome

properties.documentation: A classification of the breach in terms of its outcome, for example, 'near miss', 'no adverse outcome', or 'adverse outcome'.
properties.name: breachCategory

properties.documentation: The set of activities impacted by this workflow breach. For instance, the supply of a medication with the wrong label will impact both the downstream dispense workflow and medication administration workflow before the adverse event is observed.
properties.name: impactedDownstreamActivity

class_definitions.documentation:
Any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, disease or other medical occurrence with a possible causal association with the use of a medical product, procedure, or other therapy.
Note that the manifestation of the adverse reaction is captured in FindingTopic.result attribute.
class_definitions.name: AdverseReaction

properties.documentation: An exogenous physical substance or force that causes the disease. It does not include vectors, e.g. a mosquito that transmits malaria.
properties.name: causality

properties.documentation: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.
properties.name: exposureRoute

class_definitions.documentation: The result of an assessment of causality typically done for pharmacovigilance - i.e., whether an adverse reaction was caused by exposure to the suspected entity.
class_definitions.name: Causality

properties.documentation: A qualitative assessment of the confidence in the causal relationship, e.g., certain, likely, possible, or unlikely.
properties.name: confidence

properties.documentation: An assertion based on a causality assessment stating whether the suspected entity is causally related to or unrelated to the observed adverse reaction.
properties.name: productRelatedness

properties.documentation: Attribution information relating to the assessment of causality.
properties.name: asserted

properties.documentation: The technique used to assess causality, e.g., probability scale, bayesian, or checklist.
properties.name: method

class_definitions.documentation: A finding related to an individual's risk of harm from exposure to a substance or class of substances.
class_definitions.name: AdverseSensitivityToSubstance

properties.documentation: The substance the subject of information is allergic or sensitive to.
properties.name: substance

properties.documentation: A code that indicates whether this sensitivity is of an allergic nature or an intolerance to a substance.
properties.name: sensitivityType

properties.documentation: Category of the identified substance, e.g., food, medication, environment, or biologic. Some substances may fit multiple categories.
properties.name: category

properties.documentation: The potential seriousness of a future reaction. This represents a clinical judgment about the worst case scenario for a future reaction. It would be based on the severity of past reactions, the dose and route of exposure that produced past reactions, and the life-threatening or organ system threatening potential of the reaction type.
properties.name: criticality

properties.documentation: A documented adverse reaction(s) that was used as evidence for the allergy/intolerance assertion.
properties.name: associatedReaction

properties.documentation: Tests performed to assess sensitivity to the a suspected entity.
properties.name: sensitivityTest

class_definitions.documentation: A determination that a wound exists at a particular body site, as well as the properties or condition of that wound.
class_definitions.name: WoundAssertion

properties.documentation: A human-readable identifier for the lesion; e.g., a letter or integer.
properties.name: woundIdentifier

properties.documentation: Description of the skin around the wound in terms of color, induration, warmth and edema.
properties.name: periwoundCondition

properties.documentation: The dimensional features of the wound such as length, width, perimeter, etc...
properties.name: woundSize

properties.documentation: Description of tunneling observed for this wound.
properties.name: tunneling

properties.documentation: Description of undermining observed for this wound.
properties.name: undermining

properties.documentation: Description of the bed of a wound.
properties.name: woundBed

properties.documentation: Description of the edge of a wound.
properties.name: woundEdge

properties.documentation: Description of the exudate observed on this wound.
properties.name: exudate

properties.documentation: Internal structure that is visible outside the body.
properties.name: visibleInternalStructure

properties.documentation: A measure of improvement or deterioration in wound healing.
properties.name: trend

properties.documentation: Devices and/or foreign bodies visible in a wound.
properties.name: visibleStructure

properties.documentation: Is the wound associated with a device or pressure point?
properties.name: pressureUlcerAssociation

properties.documentation: The causative agent that contributes to the formation and persistence of a wound.
properties.name: wouldTypeEtiology

class_definitions.documentation: A description of wound tunneling, a track that extends from the surface of an organ to an underlying area or abscess cavity.
class_definitions.name: Tunneling

properties.documentation: Direction from center of wound to undermining, expressed using the face of the clock for orientation with 12 o'clock being toward the head of the patient and 6 o'clock toward the feet.
properties.name: direction

properties.documentation: distance from the wound edge to the farthest extent of the tunneling
properties.name: length

class_definitions.documentation: Assessment of deep tissue (subcutaneous fat and muscle) damage around the wound margin.
class_definitions.name: Undermining

properties.documentation: Direction from center of wound to undermining, expressed using the face of the clock for orientation with 12 o'clock being toward the head of the patient and 6 o'clock toward the feet. Reference: Brown, P., 2009
properties.name: direction

properties.documentation: The distance from the wound edge to the farthest extent of the undermining.
properties.name: length

class_definitions.documentation: Assertion about the exudate associated with a wound.
class_definitions.name: WoundExudate

properties.documentation: The consistency of exudate that is present in a wound.
properties.name: consistency

properties.documentation: The odor of the exudate.
properties.name: odor

properties.documentation: The color of exudate that is present in a wound.
properties.name: color

properties.documentation: The exudate drainage amount when quantifiable.
properties.name: drainageAmountQuantitative

properties.documentation: The exudate drainage amount assessed using a qualitative scale, for example, none, scant, small, moderate, large. Use of the Bates-Jenson wound assessment tool is recommended.
properties.name: drainageAmountQualitative

class_definitions.documentation: Characteristics of the wound's base.
class_definitions.name: WoundBed

properties.documentation: Wound bed appearance is how the base of the wound looks and depends upon the stage of healing; if healing well, may not be differentiated from the edge.
properties.name: appearance

properties.documentation: Colors within the base of the wound.
properties.name: color

class_definitions.documentation:
The BradenScaleAssessmentResult class captures the results of evaluating a patient with the Braden Scale to assess an adult patient's susceptibility to skin breakdown. The summation of the scores ranges from 6-23.
Note: this class does not represent the assessment instrument itself which is considered to be a knowledge artifact rather than an entry in a patient record.
class_definitions.name: BradenScaleAssessmentResult

properties.documentation: The moisture exposure attribute is an element of the braden score skin assessment tool. It evaluates the degree to which skin is exposed to moisture. Values range from 1-4 and correspond as follows: '1'corresponds to the patients being constantly moist, '2' corresponds to Moist, '3' to Occasionally moist, and a '4' to Rarely moist.
properties.name: moistureExposure

properties.documentation: An element of the braden score skin assessment tool. This section evaluates a patient's ability to respond meaningfully to pressure-related discomfort. Values range from 1-4 and correspond as follows: '1' corresponds completely limited ability, '2' corresponds to a Very Limited ability, '3' to a Slightly Limited ability, and a '4' to No Impairment.
properties.name: sensoryPerception

properties.documentation: An element of the braden score skin assessment tool. This section evaluates the patient's degree of physical activity. Values range from 1-4 and the numbers correspond as follows: '1'corresponds to the patients being bedfast, '2' corresponds to Chairfast, '3' to Walks occasionally, and a '4' to Walks frequently.
properties.name: physicalActivity

properties.documentation: An element of the braden score skin assessment tool. This section evaluates the patient's ability to change and control their body position. Values range from 1-4 and correspond as follows: '1'corresponds to the patient being completely immobile, '2' corresponds to 'Very limited' mobility, '3' to 'Slightly Limited' mobility, and a '4' to 'No limitations'.
properties.name: physicalMobility

properties.documentation: An element of the braden score skin assessment tool. This section evaluates the patient's usual food intake pattern. Values range from 1-4 and correspond as follows: '1'corresponds to 'very poor' nutrition, '2' corresponds to 'probably inadequate' nutrition, '3' to 'Adequate' nutrition, and a '4' to 'Excellent'.
properties.name: nutritionIntakePattern

properties.documentation: An element of the braden score skin assessment tool. This section evaluates the patient's potential exposure to skin friction and shear. Values range from 1-3 and correspond as follows: '1' corresponds to 'Problem' with friction and shear, '2' corresponds to 'Potential problem', '3' to 'No apparent problem'.
properties.name: frictionAndShear

properties.documentation: The summation of the 6 elements of the braden score skin assessment tool. Values range from 6-23.
properties.name: totalScore

properties.documentation: The overall, qualitative risk to the patient based on the Braden Total Score and the answers are No Risk: Total score 19-23 , Mild risk: total score 15-18 , Moderate risk: total score 13-14 , High risk: total score 10-12 , and Very high risk: total score 9 or lower .
properties.name: riskLevel

class_definitions.documentation: Characteristics of the wound's edge.
class_definitions.name: WoundEdge

properties.documentation: The appearance of the edge of a wound.
properties.name: appearance

properties.documentation: Color of wound edge
properties.name: color

class_definitions.documentation: Dependent statement indicating the presence or absence of tunneling.
class_definitions.name: TunnelingComponent

class_definitions.documentation: Dependent statement indicating the presence or absence of undermining.
class_definitions.name: UnderminingComponent

class_definitions.documentation: Dependent statement indicating whether the wound has exudate and the nature of that exudate.
class_definitions.name: WoundExudateComponent

class_definitions.documentation: The area of identified wound bed appearance (necrotic, sloughing, etc.; see LOINC 72371-8) compared to the total area of the wound bed. For example, 40% of the wound bed is necrotic. Results can either be subjective or measured.
class_definitions.name: WoundBedAppearance

properties.documentation: Wound bed appearance is how the base of the wound looks and depends upon the stage of healing; if healing well, may not be differentiated from the edge.
properties.name: appearance

properties.documentation: The percentage of the wound with the given appearance.
properties.name: percentCovered

class_definitions.documentation: The area of identified wound bed color (red, pink, black, white) compared to the total area of the wound bed. For example, 40% of the wound bed is black. Results can either be subjective or measured.
class_definitions.name: WoundBedColor

properties.documentation: Colors within the base of the wound.
properties.name: color

properties.documentation: The percent of the wound bed with the given color.
properties.name: percentCovered

class_definitions.documentation:
Archetypes act as the configuration basis for the particular structures of instances defined by the reference model. To enable archetypes to be used to create valid data, key classes in the reference model act as root points for archetyping; accordingly, these classes have the archetype_details attribute set.
An instance of the class ARCHETYPED contains the relevant archetype identification information, allowing generating archetypes to be matched up with data instances.
class_definitions.name: Archetyped

properties.documentation: Globally unique archetype identifier.
properties.name: archetype_id

properties.documentation: Version of the CIMI reference model used to create this object. Expressed in terms of the release version string, e.g. 1.0 , 1.2.4 .
properties.name: rm_version

class_definitions.documentation: Most classes in the CIMI reference model inherit from the Locatable class, which defines the idea of 'locatability in an archetyped structure'. Locatable defines a runtime name and an archetype_node_id. The archetype_node_id is the standardised semantic code for a node and comes from the corresponding node in the archetype used to create the data. The only exception is at archetype root points in data, where archetype_node_id carries the archetype identifier in string form rather than an interior node id from an archetype. Locatable also provides the attribute archetype_details, which is non-Void for archetype root points in data, and carries meta-data relevant to root points. The name attribute carries a name created at runtime. The 'meaning' of any node is derived formally from the archetype by obtaining the text value for the archetype_node_id code from the archetype ontology section, in the language required.
class_definitions.name: Locatable

properties.documentation: The standardised semantic code for a node, which comes from the corresponding node in the archetype used to create the data. For archetype root points, the archetype_node_id carries the archetype identifier in string form rather than an interior node id from an archetype.
properties.name: archetype_node_id

properties.documentation: A name created at runtime
properties.name: name

properties.documentation: Archetype_details carries meta-data relevant to root points. It is null for non-root points in data.
properties.name: archetype_details

class_definitions.documentation: Abstract class defining quantified amounts.
class_definitions.name: NumericalValue

properties.documentation: The accuracy of the value, in terms of number of significant figures. For example, a number like 12,345.67 might be declared as accurate to 3 significant digits, meaning digits in the 10's place, 1's place, or to the right of the decimal represent false precision.
properties.name: precision

class_definitions.documentation: A Text in a human language whose meaning is captured as concept in a formal terminology. Since CodedText is a subtype of Text, it can be used in place of it, effectively allowing the type Text to mean a text that may optionally be coded. A common use is to record the coded version of a verbatim text (a text originally selected or entered by a human).
class_definitions.name: CodedText

properties.documentation: A concept from a formal terminology that is equivalent to the semantics of CodedText.value.
properties.name: concept

properties.documentation: Modified the definition further as follows: A concept, usually drawn from an alternative code system, that is related to CodedText.concept. Mapping may be used, for instance, when the originator uses a local terminology but also supplies one or more equivalents from standard terminologies (e.g. LOINC).
properties.name: mapping

class_definitions.documentation: A countable quantity, used for values such as number of pregnancies or number of cigarettes smoked in a day. Not to be used for amounts that have units.
class_definitions.name: IntegerType

properties.documentation: The integer count value.
properties.name: value

class_definitions.documentation: Serves as a common ancestor of all CIMI simple and complex data types.
class_definitions.name: DataType

class_definitions.documentation: Represents one day in time, as measured on the Gregorian calendar, used for recording time when the exact time is unknown or excessive precision is undesired, such as birth dates. Date uses the semantics defined by ISO 8601.
class_definitions.name: Date

class_definitions.documentation: An abstract class representing a point in time to some accuracy, following the semantics of ISO 8601.
class_definitions.name: TemporalValue

properties.documentation: A date/time string following the semantics of ISO8601.
properties.name: value

class_definitions.documentation: Represents a length of time, independent of any specific point time. Duration is expressed in customary format, i.e. days, hours, minutes, etc. Note that durations cannot be used to represent points or intervals in time.
class_definitions.name: Duration

properties.documentation: An string expressed in terms of days, hours, minutes, seconds, whose semantics follow ISO8601.
properties.name: durationText

class_definitions.documentation: Abstract parent class for all types of encapsulated data, such as media files.
class_definitions.name: EmbeddedContent

class_definitions.documentation: A generic class defining an interval (i.e. range) of any ordered value type. The type T must be a descendant of the type OrderedValue.
class_definitions.name: IntervalValue

properties.documentation: A flag, when true, indicates the specified lower bound is part of the interval. If the interval is lower unbounded, this flag is ignored.
properties.name: lowerIncluded

properties.documentation: A flag indicating the interval does not have a lower bound. If true, a lower bound may not be specified.
properties.name: lowerUnbounded

properties.documentation: A flag, when true, indicates the specified upper bound is part of the interval. If the interval is upper unbounded, this flag is ignored.
properties.name: upperIncluded

properties.documentation: A flag indicating the interval does not have an upper bound. If true, an upper bound may not be specified
properties.name: upperUnbounded

properties.documentation: The lower bound of the interval. Values below the lower bound lie outside the interval.
properties.name: lower

properties.documentation: The upper bound of the interval. Values above the upper bound lie outside the interval.
properties.name: upper

class_definitions.documentation: A representation of media files, such as audio, visual, biosignal, and similar types.
class_definitions.name: Multimedia

properties.documentation: Text to display in lieu of multimedia display/replay.
properties.name: alternateText

properties.documentation: The actual data found at uri, if supplied inline.
properties.name: data

properties.documentation: Data media type representing the mime type of the content.
properties.name: mediaType

properties.documentation: URI reference to electronic information stored outside the record as a file, database entry etc, if supplied as a reference.
properties.name: resourceIdentifier

class_definitions.documentation: Represents rankings and scores, e.g. pain, Apgar values, etc, where there is a) an implied ordering, b) no implication that the distance between each value is constant, and c) the total number of values is finite. This class can be used for recording symbolic values, e.g., the results on a urinalysis strip {neg, trace, moderate, ...} or numbers like Agar values {0, 1, 2, 3, ...}. Note that although the term "ordinal" in mathematics means natural numbers only, here any integer is allowed, since negative and zero values are often used by medical professionals for values around a neutral point, for example {-3, -2, -1, 0, 1, 2, 3} for reflex response values.
class_definitions.name: OrdinalConcept

properties.documentation: The rank order in the enumeration of values, used for sorting. While any integer value can be used, the values need to reflect the order in the set. For example, ordering as {1, 2, 3, ...} has the same effect as ordering as {0, 1, 2, ...}
properties.name: positionInSet

class_definitions.documentation: Encapsulated data expressed as a parsable text. The internal syntax of the data item is not described, but must follow the given formalism.
class_definitions.name: ParsableContent

properties.documentation: Name of the formalism, e.g. GLIF 1.0 , Proforma etc.
properties.name: formalism

properties.documentation: The string, which may validly be empty in some syntaxes.
properties.name: value

class_definitions.documentation: A text with optional human language. While the attributes of PlainText and Text are the same, the PlainText class should be used when the text will not be coded (since CodedText is a child of Text but not PlainText).
class_definitions.name: PlainText

class_definitions.documentation: Abstract class defining a value on a number line or time line, whose location (magnitude) may be given precisely, or bounded by another value.
class_definitions.name: OrderedValue

class_definitions.documentation: Quantified type representing scientific quantities, i.e. quantities expressed as a magnitude and units of measure. Quantities can also be used for time durations, where it is more convenient to treat these as simply a number of seconds rather than days, months, years.
class_definitions.name: Quantity

properties.documentation: Units, expressed expressed as codes (generally UCUM), e.g. "kg/m2", "mm[Hg]", "ms-1", "km/h". Implemented accordingly in subtypes.
properties.name: units

properties.documentation: Numeric magnitude of the quantity.
properties.name: value

class_definitions.documentation: Represents an alternative ("mapped") Concept associated with a source concept (i.e., CodedText.concept or the textual value of the CodedText when no equivalent concept has been defined), and the relative match of the mapped Concept with respect to the source Concept. Mappings may be used to add classification terms (e.g. adding ICD classifiers to SNOMED descriptive terms), for computational convenience, or to provide equivalents in other terminologies (e.g. across nursing vocabularies).
class_definitions.name: TermMapping

properties.documentation: The relative match of the mapped concept to the original (target) concept. Examples include broader (i.e., the mapped term is more general than the original), equivalent, narrower (e.g. mapped concept is "atypical diabetes mellitus" and the original term is "diabetes mellitus"), or unknown.
properties.name: match

properties.documentation: The purpose of the mapping, e.g., automated data mining, billing, or interoperability.
properties.name: purpose

properties.documentation: The target concept of the mapping, i.e., the original concept that has been mapped.
properties.name: target

class_definitions.documentation: Abstract parent for plain textual and coded text items, which may contain any amount of legal characters arranged as e.g. words, sentences etc (i.e. one Text may be more than one word). Visual formatting and hyperlinks may be included.
class_definitions.name: Text

properties.documentation: The text itself, which may contain any amount of legal characters arranged as e.g. words, sentences etc. Visual formatting and hyperlinks may be included.
properties.name: value

properties.documentation: The text's language.
properties.name: language

class_definitions.documentation: Represents a point in time from an origin usually interpreted as meaning the start of the current day. Used for recording a time of (any) day, not an absolute point in time. Typically used for times of events such as substance administrations.
class_definitions.name: Time

class_definitions.documentation: A reference to an object which conforms to the Universal Resource Identifier (URI) standard. See "Universal Resource Identifiers in WWW" by Tim Berners-Lee at http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt.
class_definitions.name: UriType

properties.documentation: Value of URI
properties.name: value

class_definitions.documentation: An instant in time - known at least to the second and always includes a time zone. Note: This is intended for precisely observed times (typically system logs etc.), and not human-reported times - for them, use date and dateTime. instant is a more constrained dateTime
class_definitions.name: Instant

class_definitions.documentation: An integer whose value is greater than zero.
class_definitions.name: PositiveInteger

class_definitions.documentation: An integer whose value is greater or equal to zero.
class_definitions.name: UnsignedInteger

class_definitions.documentation: A parameterizable ratio, where the numerator and denominator should not be reduced to a decimal, such as 3 tablets/day.
class_definitions.name: Ratio

properties.documentation: The denominator of the ratio.
properties.name: denominator

properties.documentation: The numerator of the ratio.
properties.name: numerator

class_definitions.documentation: The representation of a conceptual idea represented by an ontology or controlled vocabulary.
class_definitions.name: Concept

properties.documentation: The preferred language-specific textual rendition of the code attribute, preferably as specified by the code system.
properties.name: display

class_definitions.documentation: A formal terminology system.
class_definitions.name: CodeSystem

properties.documentation: The human-readable designation of the code system, for example, LOINC or SNOMED-CT.
properties.name: name

properties.documentation: The version of the vocabulary being used, if applicable.
properties.name: version

properties.documentation: The URI formally identifying the code system in a version-independent manner.
properties.name: uri

class_definitions.documentation: A location on the surface of the Earth, described by a latitude and longitude (and optional altitude).
class_definitions.name: GpsLocation

properties.documentation: Longitude with WGS84 datum
properties.name: longitude

properties.documentation: Latitude with WGS84 datum
properties.name: latitude

properties.documentation: Altitude with WGS84 datum
properties.name: altitude

class_definitions.documentation: A date, date and time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month) as used in human communication. If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates. The time "24:00" is not allowed.
class_definitions.name: DateTime

class_definitions.documentation: Rational numbers that have a decimal representation. Decimals may not use exponents, and leading 0 digits are not allowed.
class_definitions.name: Decimal

properties.documentation: The value of the decimal number.
properties.name: value

class_definitions.documentation: Abstract supertype. Usually maps to a type like "Any" or "Object" in an object system. Defined here to provide the value and reference equality semantics.
class_definitions.name: Any

class_definitions.documentation: A collection of ordered items that may be are indexed by number.
class_definitions.name: Array

class_definitions.documentation: An ordered collection of items with non-unique membership.
class_definitions.name: List

class_definitions.documentation: logical True/False values; usually physically represented as an integer, but need not be
class_definitions.name: Boolean

class_definitions.documentation: a type whose value is an 8-bit value.
class_definitions.name: Byte

class_definitions.documentation: a type whose value is a member of an 8-bit character-set (ISO: "repertoire").
class_definitions.name: Character

class_definitions.documentation: An integer type
class_definitions.name: Integer

class_definitions.documentation: 32-bit real numbers in any interoperable representation, including single-width IEEE floating point
class_definitions.name: Real

class_definitions.documentation: represents unicode-enabled strings
class_definitions.name: String

class_definitions.documentation: A URI
class_definitions.name: Uri

class_definitions.documentation: Base class for addresses to be specialized based on regional and realm-specific needs.
class_definitions.name: Address

properties.documentation: Concept indicating purpose of this address such as whether the address is a home address or a work address.
properties.name: use

properties.documentation: Concept indicating whether this address is preferred.
properties.name: preferenceIndicator

properties.documentation: Concept indicating whether a person has no fixed address.
properties.name: noFixedAddressIndicator

properties.documentation: Unstructured address when a structured address is not obtainable or for systems that cannot process structured addresses.
properties.name: addressAsText

class_definitions.documentation: A generic and not fully structured address expressed using postal conventions (as opposed to GPS or other location definition formats).
class_definitions.name: GenericAddress

properties.documentation: This component contains the house number, apartment number, street name, street direction, P.O. Box number, delivery hints, and similar address information.
properties.name: line

properties.documentation: The name of the city, town, village or other community or delivery center.
properties.name: city

properties.documentation: The name of the administrative area (county).
properties.name: district

properties.documentation: Sub-unit of a country with limited sovereignty in a federally organized country. A code may be used if codes are in common use (i.e. US 2 letter state codes).
properties.name: state

properties.documentation: A postal code designating a region defined by the postal service.
properties.name: postalCode

properties.documentation: Country - a nation as commonly understood or generally accepted.
properties.name: country

properties.documentation: Time period when address was/is in use.
properties.name: periodOfUse

class_definitions.documentation: Data structure representing an electronic contact such as an email address or a phone number.
class_definitions.name: ElectronicContact

properties.documentation: Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact (e.g., phone, fax, email, pager, url, sms, other).
properties.name: protocol

properties.documentation: The electronic contact address.
properties.name: value

properties.documentation: Identifies the purpose for the contact point.
properties.name: use

properties.documentation: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. Contacts are ranked with lower values coming before higher values.
properties.name: rank

properties.documentation: Time period when the contact point was/is in use
properties.name: periodOfUse

properties.documentation: The period of day during which the contact should be used.
properties.name: preferredTime

properties.documentation: Concept indicating whether the contact information is the preferred means of communication.
properties.name: preferenceIndicator

class_definitions.documentation: Abstract supertype for the name of an entity.
class_definitions.name: Name

properties.documentation: The name as plain unstructured or semi-structured text.
properties.name: nameAsText

properties.documentation: Context of use
properties.name: use

properties.documentation: Time period when name was/is in use
properties.name: periodOfUse

class_definitions.documentation: Common human name format.
class_definitions.name: PersonName

properties.documentation: Code indicating the preference associated with the use of this name.
properties.name: preferredFlag

properties.documentation: The person's title - e.g., Dr, Mr, etc... - as text and optionally coded.
properties.name: title

properties.documentation: The person's given name - e.g., John
properties.name: givenName

properties.documentation: The person's middle name.
properties.name: middleName

properties.documentation: The person's surname (family name).
properties.name: familyName

properties.documentation: The suffix for the name as text and optionally coded.
properties.name: suffix

class_definitions.documentation: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package.
class_definitions.name: UniqueDeviceIdentifier

properties.documentation: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.
properties.name: deviceIdentifier

properties.documentation: Name of device as used in labeling or catalog.
properties.name: udiLabelName

properties.documentation: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a jurisdiction. All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace. with the appropriate repository uri as the system. For example, UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/fda-udi.
properties.name: jurisdiction

properties.documentation: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.
properties.name: carrierHrf

properties.documentation: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - E.g a barcode or RFID. Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats SHALL be base64 encoded.
properties.name: carrierAidc

properties.documentation: Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices. For example, the US FDA issuers include : 1) GS1: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 2) HIBCC: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 3) ICCBBA for blood containers: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 4) ICCBA for other devices: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di.
properties.name: issuer

properties.documentation: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.
properties.name: entryType

class_definitions.documentation: Describes the kind of job a person has held.
class_definitions.name: Occupation

properties.documentation: An occupation. Likely to be realm-specific.
properties.name: code

properties.documentation: The job category, such as retail, banking, construction, or healthcare ontologist.
properties.name: category

properties.documentation: Duration of time performing this occupation such as 3 years, 16 months.
properties.name: durationInOccupation

properties.documentation: Period of time in occupation.
properties.name: periodInOccupation

class_definitions.documentation: Education, training or special skills.
class_definitions.name: Qualification

properties.documentation: Concept representing the type of qualification
properties.name: code

properties.documentation: The level of the qualification
properties.name: level

properties.documentation: The organization responsible for issuing the qualification.
properties.name: issuingOrganization

properties.documentation: The issuing country where the qualification is valid.
properties.name: issuingEntityUri

properties.documentation: The date the qualification was issued.
properties.name: dateIssued

properties.documentation: The roles where the qualification applies - e.g. registered nurse, physician
properties.name: role

class_definitions.documentation: Type supporting the capture of residency information.
class_definitions.name: Residency

properties.documentation: The country or state of residence.
properties.name: region

properties.documentation: Period when residency was in effect.
properties.name: dateRange

class_definitions.documentation: Type representing proficiency in a language.
class_definitions.name: LanguageCapability

properties.documentation: ISO code representing the language name.
properties.name: languageCode

properties.documentation: The channel of communication evaluated; e.g., spoken, written, heard.
properties.name: mode

properties.documentation: Degree of fluency in the language.
properties.name: proficiency

properties.documentation: Code indicating need for translator.
properties.name: translatorRequired

properties.documentation: Code indicating whether the language is preferred for communication.
properties.name: preferenceIndicator

class_definitions.documentation: Type supporting the capture of birth-related information.
class_definitions.name: BirthData

properties.documentation: When the birth occurred.
properties.name: birthDatetime

properties.documentation: Address where birth occurred.
properties.name: birthAddress

properties.documentation: Indicates whether the birth event was a multiple birth event.
properties.name: multipleBirthIndicator

properties.documentation: The number of babies resulting from a single pregnancy
properties.name: birthPlurality

properties.documentation: Integer indicating the sequence number of this birth.
properties.name: birthOrder

properties.documentation: The birth certificate number associated with this birth.
properties.name: birthCertificateNumber

class_definitions.documentation: Type supporting the capture of citizenship information.
class_definitions.name: Citizenship

properties.documentation: Code representing the country of citizenship.
properties.name: country

properties.documentation: The period when the citizenship was held.
properties.name: dateRange

class_definitions.documentation: Information of about a death event.
class_definitions.name: DeathData

properties.documentation: Code indicating whether the patient is deceased.
properties.name: deceasedIndicator

properties.documentation: The time of death to the level of granularity known.
properties.name: deathDatetime

properties.documentation: The age of the person at death
properties.name: ageAtDeath

properties.documentation: Identifier for the entity that provided information about the deceased status of the person.
properties.name: recordedBy

properties.documentation: Address where the patient expired.
properties.name: deathAddress

properties.documentation: The death certificate number.
properties.name: deathCertificateNumber

class_definitions.documentation: Type for representing identifiers of real-world entities. Typical identifiers include drivers licence number, social security number, veterans affairs number, prescription id, order id, and so on.
class_definitions.name: GenericIdentifier

properties.documentation: The purpose of this identifier. Use is considered a modifying attribute because applications should not mistake a temporary id for a permanent one. Applications can assume that an identifier is permanent unless it explicitly says that it is temporary.
properties.name: use

properties.documentation: Optional identifier type, such as prescription, or Social Security Number. One day a controlled vocabulary might be possible for this.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: Organization that assigned the id to the item being identified.
properties.name: issuingOrganization

properties.documentation: URI of the issuing entity when the issuing entity is not an organization.
properties.name: issuingEntityUri

properties.documentation: The namespace in which the id is unique.
properties.name: namespace

properties.documentation: The identifier value. Often structured, according to the definition of the issuing authority's rules.
properties.name: id

class_definitions.documentation: Base class representing an identifier scheme.
class_definitions.name: Identifier

class_definitions.documentation: Type supporting the capture of accreditation information.
class_definitions.name: Accreditation

properties.documentation: An identifier for the accreditation.
properties.name: identifier

properties.documentation: The type of accreditation - e.g., degree, board certified, license.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: The period of validity for the accreditation.
properties.name: validityPeriod

properties.documentation: The organization that supplies the accreditation.
properties.name: accreditationOrganization

class_definitions.documentation: Abstract ancestor of all concrete content types. A unit of content that makes up a composition - e.g., a clinical statement in a patient record, a simple or composite action is a knowledge document, a catalog entry in a catalog.
class_definitions.name: Content

class_definitions.documentation: An ENTRY is the minimal unit of logical information or knowledge documented within a composition such as a clinical statement in a patient record, a knowledge entry in a knowledge artifact, a product in a product catalog, etc...
class_definitions.name: Entry

class_definitions.documentation: A composition represents a document such as a patient record, a knowledge artifact, or a catalog definition.
class_definitions.name: Composition

properties.documentation: The content that makes up a composition.
properties.name: content

class_definitions.documentation: Represents a heading in a heading structure, or section tree . Can also be used to represent a collection of entries without metadata.
class_definitions.name: Section

properties.documentation: The content that makes up a section in a composition.
properties.name: content

class_definitions.documentation: Root class for entities such as people, organizations, and devices that have a separately identifiable existence.
class_definitions.name: Entity

properties.documentation: An identifier for an entity such as a person's social security number or a device UDI.
properties.name: identifier

properties.documentation: A human-readable description of the entity.
properties.name: description

properties.documentation: One or more images of this entity such as a profile image or a product image for a catalog.
properties.name: image

class_definitions.documentation: Base person class.
class_definitions.name: Person

properties.documentation: The person's name.
properties.name: personName

properties.documentation: The person's address.
properties.name: address

properties.documentation: Contact information for the person.
properties.name: electronicContact

properties.documentation: The administrative gender of the person.
properties.name: administrativeGender

properties.documentation: The person's marital status.
properties.name: maritalStatus

properties.documentation: Information about the birth of the person.
properties.name: birth

properties.documentation: Information about the death of the person.
properties.name: death

class_definitions.documentation: A description of a social or legal structure formed by human beings.
class_definitions.name: Organization

properties.documentation: The name of the organization.
properties.name: organizationName

properties.documentation: The address of the organization
properties.name: address

properties.documentation: The electronic contact information for this organization.
properties.name: electronicContact

properties.documentation: The department or unit in question.
properties.name: departmentOrUnit

properties.documentation: The industry code associated with this organization.
properties.name: industry

properties.documentation: The status of the organization.
properties.name: status

properties.documentation: The date range associated with the existence or relevance of the organization in the given context.
properties.name: validityPeriod

class_definitions.documentation: This resource identifies an instance or a type of a manufactured item that is used in the provision of healthcare without being substantially changed through that activity. The device may be a medical or non-medical device. Medical devices includes durable (reusable) medical equipment, implantable devices, as well as disposable equipment used for diagnostic, treatment, and research for healthcare and public health. Non-medical devices may include items such as a machine, cellphone, computer, application, etc.
class_definitions.name: Device

properties.documentation: Concept representing the type of device.
properties.name: key

properties.documentation: Lot number assigned by the manufacturer.
properties.name: lotNumber

properties.documentation: A name of the manufacturer.
properties.name: manufacturer

properties.documentation: The date and time when the device was manufactured.
properties.name: manufactureDate

properties.documentation: The date and time beyond which this device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable).
properties.name: expirationDate

properties.documentation: The "model" is an identifier assigned by the manufacturer to identify the product by its type. This number is shared by the all devices sold as the same type.
properties.name: model

properties.documentation: The device software or firmware version label.
properties.name: version

properties.documentation: A network address on which the device may be contacted directly.
properties.name: url

class_definitions.documentation: Refinement of the Person class with additional attributes.
class_definitions.name: DetailedPerson

properties.documentation: A subjective association of a person with a named category of humans sharing common history, traits, place of origin, or other inherited background. (US only) The race code associated with this person.
properties.name: race

properties.documentation: Identification with or belonging to a social group that has a common national or cultural tradition. (US only) An indicator of Hispanic or Latino origin.
properties.name: ethnicity

properties.documentation: The person's citizenship.
properties.name: citizenship

properties.documentation: The person's country of residence.
properties.name: residency

properties.documentation: The religion of the person
properties.name: religion

properties.documentation: The education level of the person.
properties.name: educationLevel

properties.documentation: The qualifications of the person.
properties.name: qualification

properties.documentation: A physical or mental impairment that substantially limits one or more major life activity, for example, caring for oneself, performing manual tasks, seeing, hearing, eating, sleeping, walking, etc.
properties.name: disability

properties.documentation: Person's occupation
properties.name: occupation

properties.documentation: The language(s) spoken by the individual.
properties.name: language

class_definitions.documentation: A description of a location in terms of who to contact at the location, and activities that may take place at the location. The subclasses of Location, GeographicalLocation and HealthCareFacilityLocation, define the actual location of the Location.
class_definitions.name: Location

properties.documentation: Names associated with this location. E.g., 10 West Bed 2
properties.name: name

properties.documentation: Indicates the type of location.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: A description of the condition of the location.
properties.name: condition

properties.documentation: Contact information associated with this location - for instance, contact information to reserve the location.
properties.name: electronicContact

properties.documentation: The interval of time when this location is relevant or available.
properties.name: validityPeriod

properties.documentation: A code representing the status of the location.
properties.name: status

properties.documentation: Indicates the purpose of this location.
properties.name: purpose

class_definitions.documentation: A position, site, point in space, or polygon, designated either by altitude, latitude, and longitude or a postal address, and may be navigated to via directions.
class_definitions.name: GeographicalLocation

properties.documentation: The location's geospatial coordinates such as latitude and longitude.
properties.name: gpsLocation

properties.documentation: The postal address associated with this location.
properties.name: address

properties.documentation: How to navigate to the location. May be context-sensitive.
properties.name: directions

class_definitions.documentation:
Capacity in which an actor is involved in an activity. For instance, 'attending physician'.
Note that attributes of the actor (an entity) that remain constant regardless of the role the actor plays should be part of the entity and not the role. For instance, a person may be a practitioner and a patient. In both cases their date of birth will be the same and thus such information should not be part of the role.
class_definitions.name: Role

properties.documentation: An identifier for the role such as a patient identifier within the scope of an institution.
properties.name: identifier

properties.documentation: The type of role taken on by an entity participating in an activity.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: The entity performing the role.
properties.name: actor

properties.documentation: Populate this field if the party is acting on behalf of another party.
properties.name: actingOnBehalfOf

class_definitions.documentation: A party may be either an entity such as a specific person or organization or a role played by an entity such as patient or care provider.
class_definitions.name: Party

properties.documentation: Used to capture a relationship between two parties outside of the already specified 'actor' and 'actingOnBehalfOf' relationships.
properties.name: associatedWith

class_definitions.documentation: A directed association to a party (i.e., a role or an entity). The PartyAssociation pattern can be used to represent a participation in an activity or a relationship that exists between two parties.
class_definitions.name: PartyAssociation

properties.documentation: The type of association between an activity, a party, or an information entry to a party. For instance, the association may be that between two people (a relationship) such as a brother or mother relationship to a patient or the association between the performer of an activity and the activity itself (performance) or the subject of an entry in the patient's record and the subject of the record.
properties.name: type

properties.documentation: The period of time when the relationship holds or held.
properties.name: validityPeriod

properties.documentation:
That target of the relationship. For instance, in a participation, the performer of a clinical action such as Dr. Smith.
Note that the target is optional when it is understood based on the party association type (e.g., a 'self' relationship for the subject of information).
properties.name: target
